186018091.review:
Dopo aver trascorso più di 1000 ore su Civilization III, posso dire che Civilization VI rappresenta una reinterpretazione brillante e innovativa della serie. Con 40 ore di gioco sulle spalle, ho avuto modo di esplorare le profonde differenze rispetto al terzo capitolo e apprezzare l'evoluzione che Firaxis ha portato a questa straordinaria saga.

La novità più evidente in Civ VI è il sistema dei distretti, che trasforma il modo in cui le città si sviluppano. Non sono più entità compatte concentrate su una singola casella, ma si espandono sul territorio circostante, permettendo di costruire distretti specializzati per scienza, cultura, commercio e altro. Questo approccio aggiunge una dimensione strategica incredibile, in cui ogni decisione deve tenere conto della geografia e delle sinergie tra i distretti. È una differenza radicale rispetto a Civ III, ma non per questo meno soddisfacente, anzi: richiede un diverso tipo di pianificazione che, una volta compreso, diventa estremamente appagante.

Dal punto di vista estetico, Civilization VI ha un design visivo colorato e accessibile. Pur molto diverso dal tono sobrio e più "serio" di Civ III, questo stile chiaro e leggibile funziona perfettamente per un gioco di strategia, rendendo immediato capire cosa accade sulla mappa. È un cambiamento di tono, ma non una mancanza: lo stile si adatta perfettamente alla complessità moderna della serie.

Anche il gameplay è straordinario. Le condizioni di vittoria sono più varie e bilanciate rispetto al passato. Che tu voglia perseguire una vittoria religiosa, diplomatica, culturale o scientifica, ogni percorso è pieno di sfide e opportunità, e spesso richiede di adattarsi ai capricci della mappa e degli avversari. L’introduzione dell’albero delle politiche civiche, parallelo a quello tecnologico, amplia ulteriormente le possibilità strategiche e consente di sviluppare contemporaneamente scienza e cultura in modo più equilibrato.

Naturalmente, ci sono alcune differenze che possono spiazzare chi arriva da Civ III. L’intelligenza artificiale, ad esempio, non è sempre all’altezza: gli avversari seguono agende definite, il che li rende più prevedibili, e a volte le loro scelte militari lasciano a desiderare. Tuttavia, la possibilità di sfruttare queste debolezze strategiche può essere vista come un elemento che aggiunge profondità, piuttosto che limitarla.

Un altro aspetto da sottolineare è che Civilization VI richiede più micromanagement rispetto a Civ III, specialmente nelle fasi avanzate della partita. Pianificare distretti, bilanciare risorse strategiche e adattarsi agli eventi casuali (come disastri naturali) può sembrare faticoso, ma è proprio questa complessità a rendere il gioco così profondo.

Civilization VI non è migliore né peggiore di Civ III: è semplicemente diverso. Non cerca di replicare ciò che ha fatto grande il passato, ma di espandere e innovare il concetto di Civilization. Ed è proprio questo che lo rende un capitolo straordinario, capace di offrire un’esperienza unica anche a chi ha vissuto gli albori della serie.

Леди и Джентльмены новая часть вышла весьма не плоха! По сравнению с предыдущей частью есть интересные нововведения. Из глобальных: 
Теперь город это город, вы строите районы и в них уже привычные Вам рынки, библиотеки, арены и т.д. зависит от специфики района. Так же была изменена система науки: теперь есть научные открытия и социальные открытия. В научных все так же юниты, возможности обработки клеток и т.д. В социальных - правительства, перки под правительства и районы.  Ну ещё интересно сделали правительство, при смене режима правления Вы теперь выбираете перки, как -1 золотой с содержания армии, больше ресурсов с районов и т.д. Так же их можно заменять за золото или в время открытия новых - что даёт возможность более гибко подбирать нужные в данный момент перки для более оптимальной игры.
Ну и стандартные минусы: бот в сражения не представляет опасности - если не задавить массой то нечего неисможет сделать.
В целом отличное продолжение! Всем ценителям советую брать

185994652.review:
Firaxis is one of the few development studios that I still get excited for whenever they release a new game. With Civilization VII right around the corner, I started playing the games that got me into the series and the 4X genre. Civilization V was a nice trip down memory lane but after replaying Civilization VI, I have to say that this is the better game. Civilization V has a better sense of atmosphere with its more realistic art direction and variety of music, but VI has so much more to offer in making a dynamic and engaging game, especially with its expansions.

Civilization VI’s basis is pretty much where V’s expansions left off. Trading is mainly done via routes created by units, religion offers bonuses to other aspects of the game and is now a victory condition itself, and the tourism system for cultural victories is pretty much a 1:1 copy of what it was in V. This was a much better foundation to build off of compared to V’s base game, which lacked a lot of non-military options. The improvements made to city-states and suzerain status through envoys is a far better way of interacting instead of literally just handing money from time to time. Spies have far more versatility and can now steal gold, works of art, sabotage production, and spawn high-powered barbarians in others’ civilizations. Amenities and housing is a much better system of preventing over expansion than global happiness. The list goes on. The most notable change is Civilization VI’s districts, which are built outside of city centers and house specialized buildings such as libraries and universities in the science district and banks and markets in the commercial district. I find this to be a huge improvement over building everything in a single city center because it requires a lot more strategy in how to make the best use of the landscape and it helps each city feel more unique now that they have to specialize in certain productions. Builders being temporary is also a nice improvement as it reduces the amount of micromanagement and clutter inside a civilization’s borders.

The expansions add a lot of new features just like Civilization V’s expansions, but I find them to be more of a mixed bag this time around. I like the climate change system and how it changes the map and causes more severe storms that can create chaos. But golden and dark ages is more of a nuisance as there is no in between for the rest of the game once the first golden or dark age begins. Loyalty, free cities, and barbarian clans that can become fully fledged city-states are cool ideas, but it can become too chaotic to deal with as the game goes on. Free cities in particular feel rather underdeveloped as you can’t interact with them beyond attacking them. And apocalypse mode and zombies, while fun, just don’t fit the grounded theme of the Civilization series. Thankfully, most of these can be individually toggled when setting up the game.

Much like its predecessors, Civilization VI’s AI is terrible. This is the second game to have the 1 military unit per tile hex system, but the computer just can’t figure out how to properly utilize units and the environment. These idiots will still have support units roaming enemy territory completely undefended despite there being an escort option to link them with a military unit so they move together now. They are even easier to fleece in trades now, and will hand away important items like great works of art for pennies. The only improvement made here is that establishing embassies and sending spies as diplomats will reveal the AI’s motivational traits and give some much needed transparency on why they are unhappy with you or what their reason for denouncing you are. Knowing this info just makes them look even dumber however, as their motivations will often conflict with actually trying to win the game.

I have a feeling that going forward, a lot of the additions to the formula that Civilization VI’s expansions made are not going to form the foundation of Civilization VII. Civilization V and its expansions were a more complete game for Civilization VI to build off of, while the expansions for VI add a lot of smaller features that don’t feel like they are meant to interact with each other simultaneously. This would work to make Civilization VI stand out more compared to its upcoming sequel, but it could also be its downfall should VII refine what was done here into something more cohesive. For now, this is my personal favorite of the modern Civilization games and is well worth playing for just one more turn.

185988308.review:
TL;DR - It's Civ. It's still the king of the 4X game. It's fun.

A solid entry in the Civ series, and has all the elements of the 4X series that I know and love. At this point, the series lacks the charm of some of the earlier entries; the mechanics have become somewhat too difficult to understand. There is also an unreasonable amount of stuff not included in the base game and the prices of the expansions are prohibitive. Civ V fixed the death ball problem from the earlier entries. There's a lot of development time and effort spent on the window dressing, graphics, Sean Bean, etc. Some of the results are spectacular, like the unique and evolving musical scoring used for the different civs. Very cool! But again, a lot of it is just window dressing and there's something to be said for the simpler times. Maybe I'm just old. I'd be more excited about a reissue of Civ 2 (just enough code updating to make it work on a modern PC, no other adjustments) and would be excited to buy it. I love Civ, but I'm not going to continue to pour money into this franchise's reskinning every few years. It's little better than CoD or Madden or any of the other yearly update games that have lost the plot and whose rationale for continuing to exist is just to get us to shell out for a product that doesn't add much that is truly fun, and often feels inferior from entry to entry with each passing version.

185947596.review:
Ao ver isso vestindo minhas havaianas (uma verde e outra amarela), um calção preto desbotado de 9,90 comprado na 25 de Março e usando minha suada camisa da seleção brasileira de 94 eu chorei lágrimas tupiniquins, levantei e bati palmas para esse exemplo de brasileiro patriota que acabei de ver na Internet no meu computador Positivo.

Como estava com a janela (gradeada) aberta, dois vizinhos que estavam passando, um com a camisa do Flamengo e outro com a do Palmeiras vieram ver o que estava acontecendo. Ao contar para eles essa história maravilhosa desse verdadeiro exemplo patriota, eles esqueceram as diferenças de time e de estado e se abraçaram. Fomos no mercado comprar um pacote de bolachas, um pacote de biscoito, bandeiras do Brasil, vuvuzelas e tintas para pintarmos nossas faces de verde e amarelo.

Enquanto voltávamos pra casa de mãos dadas cantando Coração de Estudante, um morador de rua que fora pracinha na Segunda Guerra Mundial nos parou pedindo dinheiro. Prontamente eu disse que o verdadeiro dinheiro nos está sendo roubado, pois o Brasil é rico em Nióbio e que o gigante FINALMENTE acordou.

Assustado com tamanha revelação, ele se juntou a nós e fomos nós quatro, juntos, caminhando e cantando e seguindo a canção até o bar mais próximo comprar 2 litrão de Itaipava. Nesse mesmo bar passava na TV Globo um anúncio de William Bonner dizendo que Leonardo e Daniel resolveram formar uma nova dupla sertaneja, e que estava DECRETADO o início de mais uma sexta-feira.

Choramos.

E eis que, muito emocionado, um homem levanta de uma mesa do lado e pergunta se pode se juntar conosco e começa a puxar o coro de "Deixa a vida me levar". Choramos novamente.

Este homem era ninguém menos do que Zeca Pagodinho. Ele se ofereceu para pagar a nossa conta, me trouxe bêbado pra casa de carona no seu quadriciclo e de quebra marcamos um churrasco no próximo domingo.

Muito obrigado, OP. Seu amigo é um verdadeiro patriota e me inspirou a ser uma pessoa melhor.

185889996.review:
Civilization VI and Catherine the Great: A Tone-Deaf Addition
I’ve been a fan of Civilization VI for a while. It’s a game that lets you dive into history, make big decisions, and build your own empire. But the recent update that added Catherine the Great as a leader really hit a nerve for me—and I know I’m not alone in feeling this way.

Let’s get one thing straight: Catherine the Great wasn’t just some “enlightened” ruler. She was an imperialist through and through. Her reign is tied to the oppression of countless peoples, including Ukrainians, whose culture and identity were systematically attacked under her rule. And now, in 2025, when Russia is waging a brutal war against Ukraine—committing atrocities, destroying cities, and trying to erase Ukrainian identity—Firaxis decides to celebrate a symbol of Russian imperialism? It’s beyond tone-deaf.

This isn’t just about history; it’s about context. Right now, Russia is using its history and culture as weapons in its propaganda war. Leaders like Catherine the Great are central to their narrative of dominance and “greatness.” By including her in the game, Firaxis is unintentionally (I hope!) amplifying that narrative.

Video games aren’t just entertainment. They shape how people see the world. When developers choose to spotlight certain figures, it matters. Sure, Catherine was an important historical figure—but at what cost? Why highlight her now, when the pain caused by the empire she represented is still so fresh?

As a player, I’m disappointed. As a human being, I’m ANGRY. Firaxis had the chance to show sensitivity to the real-world impact of their decisions, and they blew it. Adding Catherine the Great to Civilization VI might seem harmless to some, but to me, it feels like a slap in the face to everyone suffering from Russia’s ongoing aggression.

Firaxis, do better. History isn’t just a list of famous names—it’s about people and the lessons we learn from their stories. Right now, you’re sending the wrong message.

185875035.review:
Civ VI is a great game, but as a long time Civ V player I still prefer the latter. Some game mechanics that I don’t feel comfortable with:

[list]
[*]The barbarians are too aggressive early in the game. I know how to handle them, but they still are annoying. In Civ V I can develop my first cities without bothering too much about the roaming barbarians.

[*]Builders only can perform 3 actions. I know, this feature reduces some micromanagment, but still it’s annoying being forced to produce a new builder every now and then.

[*]The era score mechanic will punish you, if you are too slow with certain actions. This pushes the flow of the game in pre-defined directions. On top of that this mechanic is - at least in the first few games – not very transparent. I had to consult external sources (wikis) to learn how to obtain enough era stars.

[*]The district system favours the wide playstyle. Of course it is possible to play tall, but it’s still a small challenge.

[*]Compared with Civ V there is more complexity. I know a lot of players do appreciate this complexity (and I do as well!), but it takes time to get accustomed to all the different mechanics and their interplay. To mention are for example the policy cards, the district system, the boosts, the civics, the religions, the diplomacy, the amenities, the loyalty system, the governors and the natural disasters. These are all very good mechanics, far better than in Civ V (some non-existent there), but they require effort to get familiar with them.

[/list]

Don’t get me wrong, Civ VI is an excellent game and I really enjoy playing it, when I am in the right mood to follow the "Civ-VI-ways“. If you want to become good in Civ VI you’ll need effort and dedication. The aforementioned "flaws" are – seen from another perspective – actually some of the real strengths of the game.

Let me get this straight, Firaxis are experts when it comes to dopamine inducing gameplay. However, after several dozen turn you will inevitably discover that this game is completely broken and unfinished. Not in terms of bugs, but in terms of gameplay balance and AI.

The AI in the latest Firaxis games is traditionally awful. Furthermore, they made it impossible to mod it starting with the 6th instalment of the series. Moreover, it is even worse due to the snowballing effect with the districts mechanic. So during the late game you will either find your civ as an unstoppable mega-empire that crushes everything in its path, or (on higher "difficulty" settings) the AI will simply cheat and spam you with dozens of units it should not be able to build.

Just ignore this one and pick Civilization V with the Community Patch instead.

185773853.review:
Civilization VI: Where Hours Disappear Faster Than a Scout in Barbarian Territory*  

Should you buy Civilization VI? Let’s check:

✅ **Love turning 1 more turn into 3 AM bedtime stories?**  
_"Just one more turn."_ Said every Civ player ever, lying to themselves.  

✅ **Enjoy building a glorious empire only to get nuked by Gandhi?**  
Who knew the peaceful guy loved nuclear diplomacy so much?  

✅ **Can handle the heartbreak of losing a cultural victory to France because you forgot to build a theater square?**  
Lesson learned: art matters.  

✅ **Love hearing Sean Bean narrate history like a bedtime story?**  
Honestly, I'd listen to him read a shopping list.  

✅ **Want to experience friendships that turn into wars because of one border tile?**  
_“We were allies five turns ago, Harold. What happened?”_  

✅ **Enjoy the thrill of researching advanced tech while still fighting barbarians with clubs?**  
Nothing screams progress like launching a satellite while fending off cavemen.  

✅ **Think diplomacy is overrated and war is the best form of negotiation?**  
_"Hey, Catherine, remember when you called me uncivilized? Here’s 10 tanks."_  

---

Highlights:
- Gorgeous art style and music that makes you feel like a true ruler.
- Endless replayability with unique civilizations and strategies.
- Multiplayer that’s 10% strategy, 90% betrayal.  
- Expansions add even more depth and chaos (looking at you, Climate Change).  

---

Things to Consider:
- Can you forgive yourself when you accidentally set your city on fire?  
- Will you accept that the AI can hold grudges like an ex in a rom-com?  

---

**Verdict:**  
If you love strategy games, history, and the occasional existential crisis over whether to pursue science or conquer the world, *Civilization VI* is perfect for you. Just remember to eat, sleep, and save the game frequently (or not, if you love chaos).  

⭐ **10/10 Would "One More Turn" Again.**

185767870.review:
I've been a die-hard fan of Civ since the original. With hundreds of hours in it, thousands of hours in III and IV, and hundreds more in Civ V. 

I don't like this. I don't know that it's bad, but I just feel like I'd rather play Civ V, or Endless Legend. I think Civ V is the much better Civilization game, and Endless Legend does the city building better. I mean, I actually think Endless Legend I prefer over Civ V, or even Civ IV. (I can't believe I'm saying that.)

I don't think Sid Meier's name on things means anything anymore, and I think Civilization has fallen much like many of it's historical namesakes. It never really felt like a cohesive game, but like a test bed for ideas. Civ VII looks even worse, and seems like the changes are built to probably feed us more DLC and extract more $$$. 

Where Civ VI looked like they saw Endless Legend and tried to grab bits of it and cram into this game, Civ VII looks like they grabbed (the worst parts, even) of Humankind and crammed it in.

I think this is my farewell to both brands here. I'll be playing Endless Legend 2 when it comes up. Hopefully it isn't crap like Humankind.

185765777.review:
《文明6》不仅是一款充满策略和娱乐的游戏，更是一个绝佳的历史学习工具。通过亲身参与不同文明的建立与发展，玩家可以更深入地理解各个历史时期的政治、文化和科技进程。每个文明的独特机制和历史背景都让人对世界历史有了更直观的认识，尤其是游戏中的科技树、社会政策以及各类重大历史事件的呈现，都帮助玩家感受到不同文化与社会体制如何塑造了今天的世界。它将玩家带入了一个充满历史与战略挑战的虚拟世界。从古代到现代，玩家需要通过精心的规划与决策，发展自己的文明，争取在竞争激烈的全球舞台上脱颖而出。游戏的核心玩法融合了资源管理、外交策略、军事征服和文化建设等多方面元素，每一局游戏都充满了无尽的可能性。它的丰富的战略深度。每个文明都有独特的领导人和特殊单位，使得游戏的策略性和重玩性大大增强。同时，城市建设系统和科技树的设定也为玩家提供了灵活的选择空间，既可以选择迅速扩张，也可以专注于科技发展或文化塑造。在《文明6》中，玩家不仅要管理资源、规划城市和部署军队，还需要进行复杂的外交谈判，培养与其他文明的关系。通过这些互动，玩家可以学习到国际关系中的博弈与平衡，理解外交策略在现实世界中的重要性。此外，游戏对决策后果的展示也让玩家意识到每一个选择可能带来的长远影响，培养了对复杂系统的思考和全局视野。外交和联合国等机制则让玩家在与其他文明的互动中体验到更多的复杂性与趣味性。视觉和音效方面，《文明6》也做得相当出色，原子时代的茉莉花超棒的好吧。更重要的是，《文明6》通过模拟不同历史时期的科技和文化进步，让玩家亲身体验到科学发现和文化交流是如何推动社会进步的。无论是研究航海术开辟新大陆，还是通过艺术与哲学的繁荣提升民众幸福感，这些都使得玩家在娱乐的同时，能对人类文明的演变与发展有更深刻的理解。

总的来说，《文明6》是一款兼具娱乐与教育意义的游戏，它不仅让玩家享受策略游戏的乐趣，还能通过模拟历史的方式，让人对世界各国的文化、科技与外交有更加全面的了解。它不仅是策略游戏爱好者的必玩之作，更是那些喜欢挑战自己决策能力和全局思维的玩家的理想之选。我愿称之为最棒的策略游戏 ！

185727237.review:
Playability / Enjoyment 5/10
Graphics / Sound 8/10
Woke / ESG score 4/10
Story / Writing 2/10
Replayability 5/10

I am recommending this game, but if it was possible would give it a "not good but not bad" thumb.  I wanted desperately to like this game and have bought all the DLC hoping it would improve it but honestly, it is such a huge disappointment after Civ 5.  On the good side, the graphics are the best yet with nice animations, especially for the battles.  The inclusion of more natural wonders is good, and the diplomacy improved.  However, the beauty of the Civ games is that they implement a complicated idea through simple gameplay.  You can play them without worrying too much about detail, but can dig deeper into the fine tuning if you want to.  This version is way too complicated and detail oriented.   The introduction of different districts and how many houses are required to sustain your city is a pain.  Wonders and other improvements now require you to build them in certain locations and the Civics has become another tree similar to technology, which adds nothing to the game.  Managing city loyalty make war victory very difficult and overall, the game is just not that fun.  Finding villages no longer reward you with anything significant and quite frankly, I do not even bother to read what benefit they give me.  The exploration is still fun and addictive, and the wonders are shown being built again, like Civ 4, but whereas in all the other Civ games, I wanted to play them again as soon as I finished them, with this, I didn't.  I will not be buying Civ 7 unless it comes down in price by 90% or so in a Steam sale.

185705158.review:
Bit more complex than the previous versions of the game but a lot more to do and lot more fun. You have to treat it as a complex chess game with many dimensions. I have been playing Civ series since the first launch back in DOS days so I'm used to the intricate complexities of the game. People complain that it is too hard but it's like any other game, you need time, patience and practice. Just learn from your mistakes and old saved games. Try things out and challenge each difficulty level. It's a long game so don't try to rush it.

The graphics are very good and huge improvement from Civ 4/5, if you are coming from there. The tech tree and units feel more balanced now and each civilization gets a unique unit or edge over the other. Barbarians are tougher and battles are more engaging, you have to keep an eye on health, formation and recovery or you could lose units fast in higher difficulty content. 

All in all, a good game for Civ fans.

185691654.review:
This probably is the worst iteration in the series of civ games.

pros:
+ hex tiles
+ 2 separate progress trees: science and culture
+ progress can be sped up by doing stuff
+ the culture system. creating and collecting art, showing it in museums and generating culture and tourism from is a VERY nice game mechanic and creates a cultural gameplay and competition, that is detached from military dimension
+ customizable religions and the religious competition, which also can be played detached from the military dimension
+ city states


cons:
- barbarians are a idiots
- city states mechanics is boring
- roads can not be built as freely as in other civ games
- progress can be sped up by doing stupid things
- 1 unit per tile rule makes  game unplayable. in war and in peace times
- 1 unit per tile mechanic is demanding on players. but non player leaders can not handle 1 unit per tile mechanic AT ALL
- stupid AI in general
- armies and corps as replacements of unit stacks are pretty limited and disappointing
- very little time to make use of all the inventions and units. there is more pressure to progress than to expand/build (but this is a criticism to all civ games, except to the colonization series, which - surprise - does not have a progress tree)
- this game in gneral makes an unfinished impression. Like it was in developement with a lot of good intentions but then rushed to market in the end and they did not find a good answer to the 1 unit per tile problem.
- this game in general makes the impression, that it was made for kids. dumbed down. an insult for civ fans.

My recommendtion in all is (since Civ5 is unplayable as of 2025-01): 

1. Go and play Civ4. For real. It is a much better gameing experience than this game. Despite it being 15 Years old or something. And the graphics still hold
2. Go play Civilization 4 - Colonization, a spinof of civ4.
3. Play Civilization 4 - Colonization with the mod "We The People" - This will be better than your wet 4X dreams and you wont need a nother 4x game for a decade.
4. Have fun with my recommendations.

185594844.review: Turn-based strategy where getting the upper hand over your opponent is a multi-pronged and many-faceted race to the top. Start in ancient times, and progress to modern technologies faster than the other opponents on the map. I enjoyed the replay value, as the map seeding makes every game a different challenge - and the computer controlled characters made reasonable negotiations and had decent battle tactics. Being able to cooperatively play with friends and wife also solid pros going for the game. Graphics are decent with smooth cinematics, although being able to pull back on the camera a bit more on the overworld to see a little more map would be nice. All in all, a solid game with many more hours to be played.

185531956.review:
I've tried a lot of different strategy games of the same type, mainly ones like HOI 4 or Victoria 3, but this game is the only one of the bunch which I'm excited to play. This is the type of strategy game that you can excel at, but will still enjoy even if you don't know what you're doing for most of the time; this is the type of game where you can role-play as another nation, but you can ignore that part completely if you want to. This game solves many of the issues that the other map-based strategy games have, mainly when it comes to versatility and simplicity, which is why it's so fun to play over and over again.

10/10

185525066.review:
[h1] 请描述你为什么喜欢或不喜欢此产品，以及您是否愿意向他人推荐此游戏。 [/h1]

这大概是我接触的第一款回合制的战术策略游戏吧，在一个星期之内完了五十多个小时。目前也就刚刚能做到随即领袖的情况下稳定过国王级别的ai。菜是真的菜但是也确实感受到了这种类型游戏的魅力，顺便预购了文明7的创始人版[spoiler] 虽然说感觉孔老二真不配当首发的领袖也觉得文明更替系统里面中国走到最后是大清这两点稍微有些不满吧，但是毕竟咱还能退款不是，而且讲道理，啊，byd满清确实是把封建这一套玩明白了 [/spoiler]

Anyway，这款游戏的主要游戏模式在我看来大概就是规划和叠力吧，每个文明领袖之间的强度这一块感觉差的还是蛮多的。奇观系统很有趣，自然奇观系统和任务系统（指如环球航行+4时代分这种）做得蛮有趣。作为新人我觉得入门门槛并没有很高，只是容易在做饭的时候开一把玩到160t的时候闻到焦味而已（笑）

总的来说这款游戏是一个蛮适合新人，至少对我这个新人而言是一款十分优秀的游戏，好玩，爱玩。

哦对了，我的体验感的基础还是来自于有一个能带着我玩的朋友一边讲解一边带我玩了三四局之后菜梳理明白这款游戏的游玩方式。我想可能大部分人并没有这样的机会，我很早之前也看过很多人出的入门视频，可是都讲的很模糊且不成体系完全看不懂，在有人带了之后才慢慢理解一切，可能这就是这个游戏的正确打开方式吧。

祝大家身体健康！

185519575.review:
This is one of the shallowest 4x games I've played. The strategy is simple and uninspired. The tactical combat is... ok, I guess. 

Aesthetic: 2/10. Visuals/vibe not interesting or attractive.
Tactical Gameplay: 6/10. There was an attempt at some tactical thought here, it just didn't land well. 
Multiplayer: I didn't dabble. 
Story: Not relevant.
Strategic Gameplay: 3/10. Grand strategy in the game is easy, and lacks depth. Might be ok if I were introducing someone to the genre? Since this is the games main selling point, I judge it particularly harshly on this metric. 

I wouldn't recommend.

185471083.review:
This is big scam posing as civilization game. Sadly you will realize it after 2 hours of playing. It tries to look like there is a lot of deep mechanics, but its all lie. Mechanics are dumb and in 90% of time doesn't work. Not sure if Sid had head injury or grew senile or only gave name and game was made by someone else. Either way whole dev team and mainly designer are incopetent and I have doubt they finished at least elementary school. Wont write down all issues dont have 2 weeks of free time only to write this review. 
But in general:

Broken info on screen, when you get attacked you wont see how much damage you got (never saw it on my ships, when I deal damage I see it).

When you need to build something game doesnt jump to city nor give you its name (not 100% of time but 50% definitely).

Game doesn't allow you to add anything in queue when pending turn, but you can send yor unit somewhere and LOSE ITS NEXT Turn, when you are mashing buttons to get over every turn spam. 

SPAM - every turn you need to watch ugly animated leaders just saying something which doesn't have any impact. Most of the time you need to watch them (or skip it) and then wait for another screen with text he/she said previously and you need to close it why? I dont want to read through uninteresting BS every turn.

You need to wait 10s before it jumps to another active unit, its quicker to do it manually, who was so dumb to do it like that? What was wrong on CIV 5 way?

Districts, maybe good idea in beggining, but as it takes and eliminates all resources its placed upon (and same for wonders), it limits hugely what you can build.

War/Domination victory - my favourite game mode is missing. It looks like its there, but its not playable - more at loyalty.

Loyalty - dumbest person on earth (designer) came with this. Its utterly broken, who was planning it spent 15 seconds thinking about this mechanic and was never tested. This makes this game unplayable as you cant conquer cities, game wont allow you to make your own cities near enemy. Unplayable. I will give you example. Played on Europe map as Germany (starting position random not according to reality). Started war with Poland in Europe. Captured 2 cities. One of them capital. I play as always on Maraton, every 2 turns captured city rebels aginst you. After that it will spawn 2 units on your level. So tell me how can city generate every 2 turns  musketeers which costs 60 nitre and not losing pop anything when oposing CIV wasnt as advanced as I (where did they got weapons)? Where did they got resources? Where they got people when I recaptured city 25+ times (then I quitted game as its broken beyond repair)? How they can produce 2 units every 2 turns when one of them takes 20+ turns in 10+ city? I tried looking in Reddit and followed every instruction: added governor, had unit in city, changed all my policies for loyalty, and max I got is 3 turns instead of 2. Lenses showed 3 presure from poland 3 from me. Absolutelly broken. Problem is that you can ignore all advices on reddit as they are bunch of BS. If you build monument which then became destroyed and you cant repair it with money when recapturing city, its useless, What you can do in 2 turns on marathon? It should be like 200+ turns to rebel. Also dont bother do anything they says, most points is from governor + 8 rest like 2 or 3. but if you get straight -30 points for inhabitants (what? As I had to recapture it 25+ times its level 1 city, still -20 for inhabitants, broken doesn't reflect game reality) and for grievenes of city founder (how he/she can affect it? all rebels would be dead during first rebelion anyway). Only way to play it is via mod as with disabled (and this is practically disabling it) war in CIV when its not possible to capture enemy capital in any way, its not CIV anymore.

No way how to kill all inhabitants of city to get rid of loyalty isses. Remember Total War series? In first Rome you could basically get rid of 80% of inhabitants when you conquer city.

No city Razing. For various reasons you had to get rid of them, no longer option. Only option is after city capture, and only if you havent captured it during current war and its not capital. Again who is so brain damaged to come up with this (especially considering how they broke other mechanics)?

Game forces you to open governor screen every 2nd turn you lose city because of rebelion (cant end turn without opening it). 

If you forgot to move any of your unit, in other civs when clicking on end of the turn you will jump to that unit, here it often happens dring half of the enemy turn..

Golden/Dark age. Another totaly dumb mechanics, in order not to get serious disadvantage game forces you to have its pace you cant set your own. You need to choose how you will get points (during gold age you cant get them only by doing something for the first time like starting inqusition. which is dumb as you always risk getting dark age after golden, even if I managed to get 2 gold in rows). Its not that hard to avoid dark age (never got it myself), but its forcing you to do what you dont want and especially when you dont have time, or free cities to deal with it as you are occupied with Loaylty bugs impacts)..

I could go on forever. This is sooo broken and I dont understand how it can have so many positive reviews with so many broken things. Its not even closely realistic  and civ was (even tho not very deep) simulator. Half of mechanics is broken rest is to plain withot dept (no more roads, builders build instantly etc.) Also 90% of game is about religion, with all bonuses and all that activities you need to do around it its main part of the game.

This is thrash, they even sells your private info to 3rd parties (check EULA), they had redshell, spammed with their launcher (even if they removed it). and of course you need to see adds for another civ in Menu. Also devs with low iq are asking every time if I agree with terms (which I say no), why asking every single time. My answer wont change.

From beloved Firaxis Games we have bunch of incopetent and not very clever people, who cares only about getting money from our personal data. Definitely wont buy CIV7. If youu want to play it, install 4 or 5 instead.

Look....we all love the Civ core game, and are glad it exists. That said:
[olist]

[*]If you don't have any Civ game and enjoy turn-based empire builders, this one is a good one to buy. Beware the DLC price creep though.
[/olist]
Anyway, now that I have two home loans, its time to taunt China into declaring war again so I can take all their cities early game.

185335282.review:
绕过2k启动器打开游戏的方法
1. 打开【steam】，右键【文明六】点击【管理】，选择【浏览本地文件】
2. 来到文件界面，依次打开【Bast】→【Binaries】→【Win64Steam】
3. 右键【CivilizationVI_DX12】，选择【发送到】，点击【桌面快捷方式】
4. 回到桌面，右键快捷方式，点击【属性】，复制目标后面那一大串字符
5. 回到【steam】，找到文明六游戏，右键后左键选择【属性】
6. 将之前复制的玩意粘贴在启动选项，并在后面添加%command%字符。重点来了！添加的字符与粘贴的文字之间需要添加一个空格
7. 点击【开始游戏】

复制评论区的，每次下载都忘，放自己评论区备忘一下

起手上激怒 以后谁跟我说工业区辣鸡我跟谁急 这工业区太香了
开个玩笑
我这个观点跟自己喜欢的玩法和胜利方式有关（也就是种田） 若玩法不同那我先投降 另外个人高难度打得少若是神难大佬请随意批评 有错误也请指出
就从六代的六种胜利方式讲起 以个人公式胜利方式简述 包含DLC内容

科技胜利：又称飞天胜利  先起学院建好图书馆后起工业区发电站满上 后补研究实验室 招募大科学家大工程师推进进度 中后期在3-4个生产力最高的城市建宇航中心 后期完成发射卫星——登月——建立火星殖民地——启动系外行星探索这四个步骤 通过消耗铝资源/增加城市耗电量的项目加速系外行星探索进程 最后地外50光年胜利 并群星启动（群星也玩且也已玩吐）

个人评价：以前最爱玩 科技是第一生产力 喜欢小小原始文明发展壮大最后飞向星辰大海的过程 而科技是各方面表现最直观的 但公公又式式 玩吐了

征服胜利：起兵营召大将军 补学院发展科技 补商业中心/港口防破产/有金币升级军队 在古典/中世纪通过马格努斯总督提高效率+砍树砍出骑兵/重型战车 补几个攻城机械 解锁科技后升级为追猎者/骑士 最后征服所有其他玩家/AI的首都获胜 应该是玩家最多的胜利方式 “一切胜利转征服/以征服为辅助”所以文明6也被戏称为野蛮6 推荐打人少的图 地图太大一个个推太累了 地图小人少一般能文艺复兴时代获胜 也有大后期一回合内通过核弹+坦克斩首所有其他首都获胜的方法

个人评价：玩的少所以“野蛮六”这个外号在我个人这里并不成立 前期军队多的话太 缺 金 币 了 国库没钱/缺少对应资源军队会自动解散 这是第一次被劝退 后面在科技胜利过程中通过宣战掠夺其他文明的学院/剧院看能不能加快点胜利进度 发现前期城市在建学院工业区没空大规模造兵我的线列步兵被城墙+兵营的城防秒了 这是第二次被劝退 很多远古战狂AI经常推平对我有加成的城邦 这让我对征服印象更差 

文化胜利：先起工业区发电站拉满 后起剧院广场广播中心满上 招募大工加速奇观建造和其他方面发展 招募大艺术家大作家大音乐家获得巨作提供文化值和旅游业绩 造人造林方便造国家公园提供旅游业绩 信仰值购买自然学家摇滚乐队 或者造考古学家“挖坟” 出文物提供旅游业绩 最后当玩家的国际游客大于其他所有玩家的国内游客时获得胜利

个人评价：现在最爱玩 同样是公公又式式但最近对国家公园有极大兴趣所以即使比科胜要慢 但依旧享受“种树种出国家公园”的奇妙感觉 看着一地的魅力惊艳和美丽的国家公园莫名有一种被治愈的感觉

宗教胜利：圣地拉满 积累大预言家点数创立宗教 选择前两个宗教信条（职业道德永远滴神）获得信仰值造传教士传播宗教 造使徒 前两个传道信仰选择剩下两个宗教词条 与其他文明创立宗教的传教士使徒打赛博“魔法战争” 最终当世界上过半国家主要信奉宗教为玩家创立时获得胜利

个人评价：社区大多数玩家认为宗辅是神 也就是职业道德提供生产力这个官方轮椅 或者十字军这个信条辅助配合某些文明（拜占庭）特性方便征服胜利 但我个人玩的少 一是使徒传教士单位过多后期一回合要操作二三十多下过于繁琐耗时 二是如最开始所说 个人觉得工辅比较香 
另外个人第一次完成神难度是开了个小图和彼得 算是半开挂通过宗教胜利完成的成就

外交胜利：风云变幻DLC内容 游戏在中世纪后会在每个时代开始时召开世界会议 玩家通过花费外交点数对固定议程进行投票 若个人投票选项与投票结果相符则+1外交胜利点数 后期有直接获得外交胜利点数的议程和奇观（摩诃菩提寺+1 布达拉宫+1 自由女神像+4点数） 有各类竞赛举行 另外有时会触发紧急状况 参与会获得加成 最后外交胜利点数达到20获胜

个人评价：每个时代开始的会议议程投对了会对游戏进程有较大促进 比如说某一兵种加战斗力 “一切胜利转征服”导致大部分紧急状况都可以通过军事科技实力的碾压来无视甚至反推 配合上其他AI玩家的过于弱智导致议程对玩家毫无影响 除非是刚开始不会玩不然该推平还是推平 对胜利过程无影响
 
分数胜利：游戏过程中系统会对玩家帝国的各方面进行量化评价评分并相加为玩家分数 如标准速度500回合时未达成以上任意胜利 

个人评价：稀有胜利方式 不故意玩不出来

个人偏好评的部分
科技市政树的设计 特别喜欢触发尤里卡的音效和带来的40%加成 个人游玩的过程中热衷于触发
两个dlc带来的新机制 比如迭起兴衰的时代，忠诚度，总督，同盟、紧急状况、年表 
风云变幻的未来新科技、世界议会 行业模式 天启 蛮族氏族
吐槽：E宝送的那个文明6只有本体 个人评价是相当于demo水平 社区里“等DLC才完整”不是玩笑话 “文明N+1” 不如“文明N”的公式是指“未出DLC的文明N+1” 不如“出完DLC和领导包的文明N” 领袖包单买DLC刚出的时候又巨贵无比 所以建议直接等2028（我猜的）年大型DLC出完甚至文明8预告出来时再趁打折买文明7捆绑包
Mod：点开创意工坊近半年/三个月/一周最火以进入二次元（确信） 重生之我在文明6启动二游 个人缺点是部分角色做的过强 速通完虐之后索然无味 个人不太喜欢

个人中等评价的部分：
文明设计 印象里都有明显的胜利方式偏向 社区里一直有“我及其讨厌某文明的设计”的声音 也有玩家热衷于针对各种胜利方式或PVP给各文明排榜 我个人兴致不大 中立 
缺点是发力点集中于某一两个时代 发力结束相当于白板（文明7：爷来了）
宜居度设计
奇观设计好在某几个奇观能切实提升游戏体验 差在强度差距过于巨大 不是强度党所以中立
个人必抢：金字塔 摩索拉斯王陵墓 基尔瓦基斯瓦尼 紫禁城 布达拉宫 马拉卡纳体育场

偏差评的部分（越往后越差）
成就系统：偏中评 放这里是因为对成就/白金党极度不友好 个人成就137/320 某些成就描述很有趣（比如让大科学家达尔文去考察加拉帕戈斯群岛）
蛮族：喜欢我马寨一回合一匹马/弓骑兵掠夺商路掠夺改良推平分城吗？ 好在触发概率不大
后期体验：个人不想玩宗胜的原因之一，后期要管的事情太多了 一回合三四分钟 也因此爆铺（指建很多城）在我这也只吃香了一小会
间谍：造价高 进攻型行动几率低导致体验差 还会被抓/杀武则天除外（听说强但没试过）
社区：=叛军 武秦除外 
兵种:科技提升带来的军队实力提升过大导致一旦落后 打架比较坐牢（也是我个人不喜欢征服的原因）另外除了几个远古战狂 会大量造兵的AI不会太多导致想打征服的话杀的不够爽 几个回合对面就没兵打了 想体验只能去PVP体验与真人打
海战：同兵种 这个更严重因为造出来没敌人打 巧妇难为无米之炊啊 除非PVP
谴责六：你往海里撒尿了所以谴责你 你海军太弱了所以谴责你 你在黑暗年代所以谴责你 我：？？？ 各种莫名其妙的谴责理由（难度越高谴责倾向越高 打你的几率也越高）导致右上角脸全红是文明6常态 也因此我经常在科技稍微领先之后cos慈禧 齐宣只求不让他们的谴责和对我的指指点点打扰我种田
AI：前几项或多或少有这个的影子
战斗方面电脑AI过于弱智 我个人经常在古典时代被突袭然后三个弓箭手+临时起的远古城墙防住千军万马 持久战？笑 弩手骑士出来杀得更快乃至反推了
另一方面文明6中每个文明AI都会有根据现实对各文明设立的议程 AI会对玩家对议程的满足（遵守/违反）情况决定对你的态度 进而进行宣友/谴责
丧尸模式：脏话已被省略 武秦除外
多人PVP及特殊模式没玩过不作评价

最后是一些杂项感受和吐槽
砍树：砍树直接给生产力？香！砍雨林还同时给食物方便上人口？更香！ 就是“木制火箭”这个梗有点破坏所谓的“代入感” 注：指大后期在原始树林多的地方起宇航中心 派马格努斯和已造好的工人砍树促进宇航中心建造进度和项目进度
文胜：游戏中的文化胜利方式深究之后会发现实质上是通过文化入侵的方式来达成（看的评论区评论 细思极恐）
马升级：马吃铝升级变成直升飞机是什么鬼口牙（乐）
个人最喜欢的文明：文美 现在有点太爱造国家公园了 PS：上一把存档24城41个国家公园
个人最喜欢的区域：工业区 回收开头工业区解锁对应科技过晚发力时间晚所以才被公认为辣鸡（不适合征服胜利） 但拉满之后城均100+生产力造啥都快实在是太香了、 “生产力是第一生产力”
一直没弄懂人文主义（获得一位大艺术家）文化遗产（有一个主题建筑）这两个个尤里卡该如何在硬跑完前触发 还有（拥有两个投石机 实际上拥有两个石弩就能触发）这种翻译错误问题

有的，有的兄弟。这么强的人物当然不止一个了，像这么强势的人物一共有九位，这些都是当前版本t0级别的强势人物。
远古飞机外星人——巴比伦
十字军跑马场——拜占庭
核动力圣地——俄罗斯
矿山枪佣兵——高卢
远古5锤赛马娘——英国
3半价区域——日本
中世纪军团——祖鲁
蹲坑之王——越南
双排长生军——波斯
掌握一到两个牢九门人物的话，100回合飞天灭神那都是没有问题的。如果你能掌握一半以上的牢九门英雄的话，那你打神级难度那也相当轻松。要像主播一样九位人物全部熟练度拉满那你可以直接去登上职业比赛的赛场，直接去打职业首发了兄弟。

185291634.review:
This game is good fun. You don't need the DLCs to enjoy it, but some of the features of other leaders as well as gameplay changes from expansions do add some cool and entertaining, if sometimes painful, experiences. With Civ 7 coming out soon, it's best to get this one on sale as even the complete edition can get pretty cheap. And it has loads of play time for you!

So much better with friends as well. It's a lot more relaxing to play a coop game against AI so you're not so stressed about how much you suck. I have never had issues with restarting if people crash or d/c, which that rarely would happen either.

There are a few drawbacks to this game though, most of it in the UI. I would have loved to have a filter (similar to the one for showing the religion, appeal, etc of countries) that could more easily show you what units you have and where they are. This game gets SO CLUTTERED that it gets challenging to coordinate your units for whatever you need, so much so that you can easily forget a level 0 starting scout on the other side of the world until you reach the end of the game.

185201024.review:
Pinnacle of strategy and management games. There's immense depth to each mechanic and the way in which mechanics come together to create emerging strategies is beautiful to experience. Snowballing into unstoppable momentum is a fun experience in this game.

This game has a steep learning curve but the learning is fun, and each new detail learned rewards you in a meaningful way. 

Without the DLCs, the AI opponents and their gestures become repetitive but their gameplay styles are quite varying between games. 

The pain with this game is there's too much detail and optimization involved in the early game and this is taxing and not very fun. Building towards power spikes are fun, but when keys to power spikes become available to you (great person mechanism), sometimes its difficult to figure out how to use them (as they have other dependencies to get their benefit)

"Шедевр стратегии и дипломатии"

Sid Meier's Civilization VI – это игра, которая заставляет забыть о времени. Каждый ход – это новая возможность изменить историю, создать уникальную империю и повлиять на судьбу мира. Меня восхищает глубина игрового процесса, где важна каждая деталь: от прокладки дорог до тончайших дипломатических решений.
Я советую Civilization VI всем, кто любит стратегии, историю и сложные, но увлекательные вызовы. Это игра, которая идеально подходит как для спокойного вечера, так и для напряженного соревновательного матча с друзьями. Одна из лучших игр в жанре – определенно стоит вашего времени!

185052265.review:
While I do thoroughly enjoy these games, I will never recommend them because of the way they "fix" and "balance" their games. If something isn't working correctly, or is unbalanced, they will not put out major patches minus anything that is game breaking. Instead, they'll offer the fix or re-balance as part of the next DLC, which means you have to shill out money to fix the game. 

And of course when they put out a new DLC, it always adds more fixes and balances which will never be addressed until the next DLC. It's a horrible formula they've found works, and I hate it. 

Also, their netcode BLOWS! It's always a gamble if the multiplayer will work, and then GOOD LUCK when you try to resume the game later. People can't connect, can't get their faction back, then everyone gets stuck on infinite loading screens until someone crashes, then it's back to the start.

185045139.review:
AI is very badly designed, ruining the single player experience.  AI barbarians and civs constantly makes bad decisions and engagements...it feels very random, like they just dice roll whether or not to attack or go to war.

In the early game, Barbarians are aggressively overtuned to compensate for their incompetence.  They are more advanced and have better production than any civilization possibly could.  Destroying a camp spawns another the next turn, sometimes within 5 tiles of cities and 3 tiles of city-states.  The only way to prevent spawning is 100% fog-of-war coverage.  Barbarians actively ignore city-states and civs that don't directly engage them and instead target the human player.  Worst of all, they can be easily farmed to skyrocket mid-game advancement.

In the late game, the AI civs only goal is to prevent the player from winning, effectively teaming up regardless of their diplomacy.  Farming the overtuned barbarians usually makes the player significantly ahead of all other civs.  Then, whenever you are too powerful or close to a victory condition, the AI goes crazy, wildly attacking the player even when outgunned and outnumbered.  When a computer AI is too powerful or close to a victory condition, the other computer civs ignore or outright help them win through trades and diplomacy.  Overall, weaker AI civs do not act in their own best interest or self preservation, they are only designed to artificially challenge the player.

On top of all that, the new player assistance, recommended techs and civics, and default citizen management are usually grossly wrong, often comically so (assigning the 1st citizen to a 0 food tile, then telling the player their city lacks growth 1 turn later).  As a player, you must first defeat the bad recommendations, then the OP yet moronic barbarians, and finally the AI civs which took all the bad advice you were given and combine it with the same poor decision making of barbarians.

The core single player game is extremely easy because the AI is weak in decision-making, so the devs tried to make them strong at everything else, adding "difficulty".  Truly an awful experience, and a very long and painful one at that.  Losses feel like bs, wins feel meaningless, and they each cost hours.

I got this game as 1/5 or 1/6 of a $12 Humble Bundle and it doesn't feel worth it.

I wouldn't recommend this game if it was free.  I wouldn't pay any amount for DLC.

This game is so bad, I dont know where to start. Its sucks right from the beginning, cant chose a pangea type map, every single map has coast and oceans. Dont want to play that? Tough luck.
Scouts are useless you can move 6 tiles from your starting city and get swarmed by Barbs? Just turn barbs off you say? Not possible.
You can now build so many different types of stuff and there is now civcs and on and on and on. Devs, by adding more and more stuff you dont make the game better!
It never stops getting annyoing, world congress every 15 turns? 4-5 different items to vote for. Too much. Just ignore it you say? Not possible you have to vote. I like building games and tweaking my cities but there is now so much stuff surronding you simply clickc click click to make it go away.
The game spreads out even more in later stages its absurd cant focus or concentrate on issues.
Positive is the now better upgrade trees for military and more different types of civs to pick.
Overall thumbs down gets deleted and I will play Civ V again.

184998636.review:
Поставил я город, Ташкентом назвал
Злата он много имел
На севере друг мой за Ганди играл
Играть он к слову ещё не умел

Избрал он победы дорогу своей
Религию, мир и господня
Под лозунгом этим и выкрики "бей!"
Началась кровавая бойня

Мой юный игрок Андрей-Параджа
Войну начал мировую
Ни как не поняв как вышло то так
Пол мира вошло в роковую

Начали войну против Америки злостной
Что целью кризиса стала
Грузины, Индусы армадой одной.
Французов страна в стороне не стояла

Грузин ведорас, стоит афк
Француз шьёт белые флаги
Один в той войне дал янки отпор
Дедуля Махатма наш Ганди

Коль кончился рок смертоносной войны
Индусы ошибки приняли
Не надо нам кровопролитной борьбы
Четырых черепах в пантеон своей веры наняли

Рафаэль, Донателло за мир и покой
Леонардо за веру в господня
Микеланджело один глупый такой
В мирной религии богом был преисподней

И так из эпохи в другую
Марш черепах по миру идёт
на юге Мали страну золотую
Америка злая в пыль разнесет

Разрушили город Тагил
Сожгли каждый кустик Ташкента
Одно не учли президенты страны
Что злато Мали пойдёт на вендетту

На континенте другом
Ещё сопартиец сидел и скучал
Японию выбрал самурай удалой
Стремился к тропе из научных начал


И так всё скучавши из хода да в ход
Сегунат принимает решенье
Мужиков мы с дубиной берём в оборот
Отправляй в чужой брег на отрешенье

Приплыли ребята из солнца страны
Их встретил грузин и индус
Коль первые были глупцами игры
Вторые в порыве веры своей черепаший акцент прививали для уст

На юге света златую страну
Кризисом вдруг объявили
Весь мир ополчился сразу на ту
чьи города сожгли и смесили

Кризис тот оправдали лишь тем
Что французов много погибло
Подумаешь марш геноцида прошёл
По берегу Рейна от страны златовидной

И так лишь одно государство
воюет на три стороны
С севера янки на юге же франки
Вторые погибнут от этой войны

На третьем фронте этакой бойни
Стояли Поляки да ещё Дикари
Но сегуна нашего не забываем
Поляками он даст wata shi pizdы

Сёгунат что спутники в небо пускал
Страны другие в тартар отвадил
Так пала Ядвига польский КРОЛЬяк
Ацтек уже свою душу провадил

Но Янки война и Малийцев страптивых
Шла дольше чем польский поход
Не знала Америка убивая невинных
что не ядерка ждёт их а хуже машина, имя её Аллах Шагаход

Но итога войны не увидит планета
Ведь поход черепаший окончен теперь
И не пол уже, а целая доля белого света
В вере своей черепах оценило, без споров стал мир, не будет потерь

И так мой товарищ на Индию ставший
Играть не умел почти ну совсем
Религии путь мирный избравший
Черной лошадкой утёр нос в той партии всем.

184935496.review:
《文明6》是一款由Firaxis Games开发的经典策略游戏，继承了《文明》系列的精髓，同时在游戏机制和玩法上进行了诸多创新，使其成为了一款令人沉迷的杰作。以下是对这款游戏的详细评测：


游戏画面与音效
《文明6》的画面风格延续了系列的卡通化风格，色彩鲜明且富有层次感，无论是城市建筑、单位模型还是地图上的地形地貌，都呈现出一种精致而生动的效果。游戏中的动画效果也十分流畅自然，例如单位移动时的行进姿态、战斗时的攻防动作等，都让人感受到一种真实的历史氛围。此外，游戏的音效也极具特色，背景音乐融合了不同文明的民族风情，旋律优美而富有感染力，能够很好地烘托出游戏的氛围，让人在游玩过程中仿佛置身于一个宏大的历史舞台之上。


游戏玩法与策略深度
《文明6》的核心玩法是建立和发展自己的文明，从一个小部落开始，逐步扩张领土、发展科技、建设城市、培养文化、组建军队，最终实现对世界的统治。游戏提供了多种胜利方式，包括科技胜利、文化胜利、宗教胜利、军事胜利等，每种胜利方式都有其独特的策略和要求，玩家可以根据自己的喜好和游戏风格来选择不同的发展路线。例如，追求科技胜利的玩家需要注重科研投入，合理分配资源，优先发展关键科技，同时还要防止其他文明的科技发展超越自己；而追求文化胜利的玩家则需要大力发展文化设施，吸引外国游客，提升自己的文化影响力，同时还要抵御其他文明的文化侵蚀。

游戏的策略深度体现在方方面面，从城市规划到单位配置，从外交谈判到战争布局，每一个决策都可能影响到整个文明的发展轨迹。例如，在城市规划方面，玩家需要合理布局各种建筑，如市场、大学、图书馆等，以提高城市的经济、科技、文化等产出；同时还要考虑地形对城市发展的影响，如在山区建造军事单位生产设施可以提高单位的战斗力。在单位配置方面，玩家需要根据自己的战略需求和敌人的特点来配置不同的单位，如在对抗骑兵单位时，可以配置弓箭手或长矛兵来克制；而在攻城战中，则需要配置攻城单位和远程单位来提高攻城效率。此外，游戏还引入了“政策卡”系统，玩家可以根据自己的发展需求来选择不同的政策卡，从而获得各种增益效果，进一步丰富了游戏的策略性。


游戏的可玩性与耐玩性
《文明6》具有极高的可玩性和耐玩性。首先，游戏提供了丰富的文明选择，每个文明都有其独特的领袖和特性，例如埃及文明的克里奥佩特拉拥有“尼罗河赠礼”特性，可以在河流旁建造城市时获得额外的生产力；日本文明的织田信长则拥有“武士道”特性，能够提高军事单位的战斗力。这些独特的文明特性使得每次游戏都有不同的体验，玩家可以根据自己的喜好和战略需求来选择不同的文明进行游戏。其次，游戏的地图生成具有很高的随机性，每次游戏的地图地形、资源分布、文明初始位置等都会有所不同，这使得玩家需要根据不同的地图环境来调整自己的战略，增加了游戏的挑战性和趣味性。此外，游戏还提供了多种游戏模式和难度等级，从新手玩家到资深玩家都能找到适合自己的游戏模式和难度，进一步提升了游戏的可玩性。


游戏的社交与竞技性
《文明6》不仅是一款单人游戏，还具有丰富的多人游戏模式。玩家可以与朋友一起进行本地多人游戏，也可以通过网络与其他玩家进行对战。在多人游戏中，玩家之间的互动更加频繁和复杂，不仅可以进行外交谈判、结盟、宣战等操作，还可以通过贸易、文化交流等方式来影响其他文明的发展。这种多人游戏模式不仅增加了游戏的趣味性，还提升了游戏的竞技性，玩家需要在与其他玩家的竞争与合作中不断提升自己的战略水平和游戏技巧。


总结
《文明6》是一款极具魅力的策略游戏，它以其精美的画面、丰富的玩法、深度的策略和极高的可玩性，成功地吸引了无数玩家的目光。游戏中的时间流逝得飞快，玩家往往会在不知不觉中从5点玩到4点，完全沉浸在建立和发展自己文明的乐趣之中。无论你是策略游戏的资深玩家，还是对历史和文化感兴趣的新手玩家，《文明6》都是一款值得尝试的经典之作，它将为你带来一段难忘的历史探索之旅。

184918858.review:
"Sid Meier’s Civilization VI — это игра, где вы начинаете с одной хижины, а заканчиваете тем, что отправляете спутники на Марс и одновременно пытаетесь не убить соседа, который нагло построил город прямо у вас под носом.

Начало игры: выбираю цивилизацию. Беру Ганди, думаю, будем строить мир. Через 30 ходов понимаю, что Ганди — это мастер ядерной дипломатии. Сосед попросил кусок земли, а я случайно начал разработку ядерной программы. Кто-то скажет: "Ошибка." Я скажу: "Ганди всё предусмотрел."

Дипломатия? Легко! Сначала ты даришь соседу пару ягод и говоришь: "Дружище, давай вместе развиваться!" Через 50 ходов ты уже осаждаешь его столицу, потому что он украл у тебя виноградник. Виноградник, Карл!

Самое смешное — это война. Твои противники присылают к тебе лучников, а ты в ответ едешь на танке. Они такие: "Не честно!" Но кто виноват, что я знаю, как работает наука, а вы до сих пор обнимаете деревья?

Культура — отдельный цирк. Я построил театр, а мой сосед решил, что его деревянная хижина круче, чем мой музей. Начал уговаривать, чтобы я отдал ему пару произведений искусства, а я вместо этого просто запустил в космос ракету и сказал: "А вот и нет."

Кооперативная игра с друзьями — это урок того, как легко можно разрушить дружбу. Один друг обещает: "Не буду нападать!" А потом высаживает десант из 50 танков. Ещё через ход он говорит: "Это случайно вышло."

Итог: Civilization VI — это не просто стратегия, это симулятор "как испортить отношения со всеми, но всё равно победить". Рекомендую всем, у кого есть время на партию длиной в 10 часов и нервы, чтобы выдержать дружбу с Ганди."

184912128.review:
Civilization est une franchise qui me tient particulièrement à cœur et à laquelle je joue depuis le tout premier épisode sous MS-DOS.
J'étais un peu dubitatif au début face à la direction artistique de cet opus, mais finalement, les cinématiques au style cartoon apportent une identité plus marquée par rapport à l’épisode précédent.

En ce qui concerne le contenu, si l’on pouvait ressentir quelques frustrations à la sortie du jeu par rapport à Civilization V, celui-ci s’est bonifié et enrichi avec le temps grâce aux extensions. Aujourd’hui, il propose des éléments très intéressants, avec une grande variété de gameplay et de nombreux dirigeants, chacun ayant ses spécificités.

C’est toujours le même problème lorsqu’on compare un épisode en fin de vie, ayant bénéficié de nombreuses évolutions, à un nouvel épisode "vanilla" qui nécessite du temps pour s’enrichir à son tour. On retrouvera probablement cette même comparaison prochainement entre Civilization VI, dans son état actuel, et Civilization VII en version "vanilla" même si ce dernier semble déjà magnifique (sa sortie étant imminente au moment où j’écris ces lignes).

Notons l’effort du studio qui propose son jeu sur macOS et Linux, en plus de Windows. D’ailleurs, en tant que défenseur de Linux, je tiens à souligner le travail de Steam, qui fait beaucoup pour le gaming sous Linux, contrairement à Epic Games, qui ne fait même pas l’effort de sortir un launcher pour ce système…

Pour en revenir à Civilization VI, il s’agit, selon moi, du meilleur Civilization à ce jour dans son état actuel. Le jeu propose des mécaniques variées et riches, de nombreux types de victoires et un vaste choix de civilisations. La rejouabilité est excellente, et l’effet "encore un tour et j’arrête" reste toujours aussi addictif :)

184853062.review:
[h1]Civ you loved, but with 33% less soul![/h1]
[hr][/hr][i]This is the same good old civilization which was iterated and improved. I think it is the best it has ever been. However, it seems less lively, less unique in this entry. Everything in this game feels more generic and lacks personality even if the game has high production values and aesthetics which work.[/i][hr][/hr]
[h1]Why people love grand strategy?[/h1]
This game is as flawed as it always has been. Useless AI, drawn-out turns, moving your units through nations takes decades. Those issues are still all present here. The game also tries a lot of new mechanics like climate change, dynamically changing environments, world leagues, leader agendas, and behaviors. I cannot fault Civilization for trying. I don't think that most of what they tried works, and most end up either as a nuisance or as busywork. However, they don't break the game, and well, at least Firaxis tried something new. The game didn't fix its fundamental issues, but that doesn't make this one worse for it. I don't care for their monetization model either, as Civilization games eventually always get deeply discounted, and you can pick it up for just a few euros. It ends up with truly massive quantities of content to play for very cheap. All of this doesn't matter as it is still a good Civilization game, and what makes it a good game? It is the desire to do just one more turn and the stories you make while playing a grand strategy. Stay a while and listen to my own!

Below are just snippets of a full story which I wrote after my campaign. It's stories and experiences like that which is the fuel of grand strategy games! 

[h1]Monster of your own making[/h1]
Ah, I remember when I was young and idealistic. World seemed so vast and full of potential. Vast, unexplored plains awaited me at every turn and I, Trajan, leader of Rome had led them in conquering the unknown. We settled city after city. Tamed environment left and right. Fought barbarians and brought law to uncivilized lands. In our conquests we found others who had their own goals. One was a Muslim civilization in search of coin and wealth. We happily traded with them just as with other city state which we found at the north of vast mountain chain which cut our continent in half. Past it, we managed to establish two cities, one by the sea side and other by the mountains. 
...
We were afraid to attack. Our previous encounters with South Korea had seen us encountering heavy loses to their aircraft, artillery and infantry. Thus we were slowly amassing troops. We were defending lands of our allies and with massive numbers and their seemingly reckless aggression, we managed to surround and to destroy their forces. Eventually, they had exhausted themselves in their attacks and we started pushing in. South Korean forces were depleted, exhausted, demoralized and spread way too thin across the continent. With weight of numbers and professionalism of our armies, we managed to liberate Oslo. We had continued the momentum and had captured two other cities from Seondeok. However, we could hold them as partisans kept rebelling and tying our forces down. Eventually Seondeok had reorganized and reinforced their troops and started whittling down our forces. Seeing that future war was of no use, we agreed to make peace. As last act of spite, we leveled those accursed cities and left the continent for good.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3401294753
Through years of war and constant reinforcements from the fatherland, we had managed to gain an upper hand. We had figured out tactics how to effectively combat those robots and we started to push them back. As we were pushing back, even more of them were arrriving on the battlefield, it seemed like never ending march of men or iron. We started to doubt if there is anything more for us here than death and dying for freedom of our ungrateful and weak allies. Hundred of thousands of men had died for these pigs who will forget about us when the war will end and will promptly continue their squabbling and self-destructive politics which already had led to two world wars. However, those were thoughts for later, we already had comitted and we had to survive another day. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3401293685
At this stage in the war, years after start of a world war, we managed to lift sieges of German towns and reinforce their lands with our armies. We set up positions and were fighting legions of iron men in well prepared positions. We knew how to fight them. Might of our legions were conquering all even if we expended lives of our brave Roman soldiers for bolts and circuits. We held our defenses valiantly against hordes of those machines for an year, fighting in a prepared positions or hunting their breakthrough with our armored divisions in a countryside. Year had passed and we noticed an odd change. Their iron men became slower, less aggressive, more lethargic. It was subtle at first. Fewer artillery strikes on our position. Fewer assaults on our fortified positions. We didn't noticed shift in warfare at first, but then effects became more pronounced. Their robots became slower, their shields became weaker or sometimes would fail entirely to stop our attacks. Machines themselves became slow and indecisive. Not understanding the source of their weakness, but sensing weakness and opportunity, we launched an assault on captured German cities. We liberated them easily and had trashed legions of iron men with relative ease. It seems that their armies were collapsing on their own. From captured scientists and officials, we gained a full picture of what is happening. Those robots were fueled by uranium and they devoured massive quantities of this fuel. As war raged on, Seondeok had overproduced her iron men while their uranium deposits shriveled and evaporated. In this massive strategic blunder we had managed to capture one of their cities and we set up our eyes on a capital. We defeated their armies and war was won. But we wanted to make a wound to her, such that she would not be able to recover and threaten us ever again. We continued the war and had razed their capital to the ground. For hundreds of thousands of soldiers which died in their accursed wars, we pillaged and razed their capital to the ground. We sent millions of people to the pyre, ones with some sense fled, others perished in flames. This had marked final act of vengeance in the war. We left that accursed continent as pariah state as were were. We died for their sins only to be condemned and despised by all.

This marked the final chapter of Rome's legacy. Learning lessons and seeing declining state of this world, we focused our efforts on interstellar efforts. We established bases on moon and mars. We were the first to colonize other star systems. In world which we destroyed with climate change. In a continent which we had forgotten, one which returned to their old ways. Our meddling only restored balance of power in it and locked it to a never ending cycle of warfare. There is little left in this dying world for us. Its resources consumed, environment destroyed. We returned to our roots in a way, exploring new frontiers in which to settle. We were last nation standing on Earth. Its navy, legions and distance from everyone else ensured that no one will ever bother us again. We coldly observed how rest of the world collapses into infighting over ever shrinking resources while we were slowly preparing to abandon them all. In a world which we ultimately, unwillingly destroyed ourselves.

184832437.review:
One of the Best Games Ever Played

Having started my journey with Civ IV, then moving on to Civ V, and finally arriving at Civ VI, I can confidently say that each iteration has built upon its predecessor in incredible ways. From the moment I launched Civ VI, I was mind-blown by the improved animations and the intricate details in the graphics. The new concepts introduced, like weather and CO2 management with the Gathering Storm expansion, added layers of realism and depth that I never thought possible in a strategy game.

The game mechanics are thoughtfully designed to be both challenging and rewarding. Each decision you make feels impactful, and the turn-based strategy keeps you on your toes, requiring you to think several steps ahead. The 4X genre, with its eXplore, eXpand, eXploit, and eXterminate elements, is executed brilliantly, making each playthrough a unique and captivating experience.

What stands out the most is the sense of progression and achievement. From the early game exploration to the late-game strategic conquests, every phase of the game is engaging. The addition of new leaders and civilizations over time keeps the game fresh and adds to its replay value.

Whether you're a long-time fan of the series or new to the world of Civilization, Civ VI is a must-play. It's a masterpiece of strategy gaming that will keep you coming back for more. Highly recommended!

Civ VI to jak wejście do magicznej biblioteki, gdzie każda księga opisuje powstanie, rozkwit i upadek cywilizacji. Każda tura to pióro w dłoni gracza – twórcy historii, wizjonera przyszłości i władcy swojego świata. Sid Meier, niczym mitologiczny Prometeusz, ofiarował nam ogień strategii, a my, śmiertelnicy, kształtujemy losy całych narodów.

Gdy tylko mapa rozbłyska blaskiem odkrywanych krain, a mgła wojny powoli ustępuje, zaczynamy rozumieć istotę gry: to hymn na cześć ludzkiego geniuszu. Zaczynasz od skromnej osady, której sercem bije malutki ratusz, lecz w twoim umyśle już powstają wizje wielkich miast, monumentalnych cudów i floty statków przemierzających nieznane oceany.

184686017.review:
Sid Meier's Civilization VI is a masterpiece of strategy gaming that strikes the perfect balance between accessibility and depth. Whether you're a seasoned veteran of the series or a newcomer to the world of turn-based strategy, Civ VI welcomes you with open arms—and then promptly consumes hours, days, or even weeks of your life.

The game’s dynamic world-building is mesmerizing. From founding your first city to expanding your empire and navigating diplomacy, every decision feels impactful. The districts system adds a fresh layer of strategic planning, while the visuals are vibrant and inviting. Watching your empire evolve from a humble village to a sprawling superpower is immensely satisfying.

One of the highlights of Civ VI is the AI. Leaders feel more dynamic and personality-driven, making diplomacy unpredictable and engaging. And if you tire of AI opponents, multiplayer adds a whole new level of challenge and hilarity (though be prepared for long sessions with friends).

The music deserves its own standing ovation. Each civilization’s unique soundtrack evolves as you progress through the ages, making every turn even more immersive.

The game isn't without flaws—late-game turns can sometimes drag, and certain balance issues pop up now and then—but these are minor nitpicks in an otherwise stellar experience. With its robust expansions and active modding community, Civ VI remains endlessly replayable.

Pros:
✅ Addictive gameplay with incredible replay value.
✅ Beautiful visuals and a vibrant, living world.
✅ Excellent soundtrack that grows with your civilization.
✅ Endless strategies and playstyles to explore.

Cons:
❌ Late-game turns can feel slow.
❌ Some AI quirks in diplomacy.

Whether you want to conquer the world with military might, charm your way to a diplomatic victory, or outpace your rivals in science, Civ VI delivers. It’s not just a game—it’s a time machine.

Highly recommended to anyone who loves strategy, history, or losing track of time.

绕过2k启动器打开游戏的方法
1. 打开【steam】，右键【文明六】点击【管理】，选择【浏览本地文件】
2. 来到文件界面，依次打开【Bast】→【Binaries】→【Win64Steam】
3. 右键【CivilizationVI_DX12】，选择【发送到】，点击【桌面快捷方式】
4. 回到桌面，右键快捷方式，点击【属性】，复制目标后面那一大串字符
5. 回到【steam】，找到文明六游戏，右键后左键选择【属性】
6. 将之前复制的玩意粘贴在启动选项，并在后面添加%command%字符。重点来了！添加的字符与粘贴的文字之间需要添加一个空格
7. 点击【开始游戏】

Chiant : 
-les parcs nationaux qui doivent obligatoirement faire parti d'une seule ville
-les groupes de rock qui peuvent se retrouver coincé en cas de censure.
-la victoire religieuse peut être très pénible à obtenir
-l'IA lunatique qui vous lèche les pieds en 1850 et qui vous maudit sur 5 générations en 1851
-Mozart qui doit attendre 1000 ans et une place en radiodiffusion pour pouvoir composer un morceau
-les fins de tours qui s'éternisent en fonction de la taille de la carte
-le micro-management de fin de partie 
-les actions de début et de milieu de partie sont décisives, ce qui rend la fin de partie un peu molle car dépendante de vos actions passées

Mais en dehors de ça c'est un civ de très grand cru avec des nouveautés pertinentes comme les quartiers ou l'occupation d'une case par merveille, bien chronophage comme il faut et qui peut occuper des centaines d'heures sans problème.

184596705.review:
Would I recommend Civilization VI? Absolutely.

After investing over 3,100 hours into this game, I can confidently say it's one of the most engaging and strategic games out there. Whether you're a casual player or a dedicated strategist, Civilization VI offers something for everyone.

What I Love:
Endless Replayability: Each game feels unique with the wide variety of leaders, map types, and victory conditions. No two games are the same.
Strategic Depth: The balance between diplomacy, warfare, science, and culture keeps you constantly adapting your strategy.
Beautiful Design: The art style is vibrant, and the music dynamically changes based on your civilization's progress. It's both visually and audibly immersive.
Expansions: Add-ons like Gathering Storm and Rise and Fall introduce deeper mechanics, making the late-game more exciting than ever.
Who It's For:
If you enjoy strategy games, love planning long-term goals, or want a game that allows you to rewrite history, Civilization VI is a must-play.

With over 3,100 hours of gameplay, I can say it’s not just a game—it’s a journey through time. Whether you conquer through culture, science, or domination, Civ VI keeps you coming back for "just one more turn."

184587028.review:
Игра, в которой можно сражаться слонами против танков, в которой ты летаешь в космос, но у тебя в городе нет канализации, в которой один строит фабрики, а другой воюет с варварами копейщиками... а начиная игру, думаешь, что играешь с 5 ❤❤❤❤❤❤, но потом понимаешь, что ❤❤❤❤❤❤ на самом деле 6.

Когда кентик подарил мне её, я думал, что сыграю разок просто попробовать и всё, но 72 часа за неделю говорят сами за себя...

Смотря на эту игру со стороны кажется, что чтобы разобраться в ней нужно наиграть часов 500, не меньше, по-крайней мере, такое впечатление было у меня, однако обучение максимально доходчивое, а чтобы выработать собственный стиль игры достаточно несколько раз поиграть против ботов на повышенной сложности.

Безумно затягивает, но подойдёт явно не всем: людям, которые не любят стратегии, людям, у которых плохо развито критическое и аналитическое мышление, а также тем, кто не готов 5 часов просидеть за одной "быстрой" каточкой, стоит воздержаться от покупки, остальным однозначно рекомендую.

184544097.review:
[b]Genel Bakış[/b]

Sid Meier's Civilization VI (Civilization 6), efsanevi strateji serisinin altıncı oyunudur ve oyuncuları dünya tarihini şekillendirirken büyük imparatorluklar kurma görevine sürükler. Bu oyun, yönetim, keşif, savaş, ticaret ve diplomasi gibi unsurları içerir, oyuncuların ekonomik, askeri ve kültürel gücünü bir arada yönetmesine olanak tanır. Civilization VI, her bir medeniyetin avantajlarından faydalanarak, kazanmanın çeşitli yollarını sunar. Geliştirilmiş yapay zeka, derin strateji sistemi ve oynanabilirlik açısından güçlüdür ancak bazı kararlar, tekrarlayıcı hale gelebilir.

[b]Oynanış Mekanikleri[/b]
Civilization VI, önceki oyunlardaki mekanikleri daha da genişletmiş ve derinleştirmiştir. Oyuncu, şehirleri kurar, kaynakları yönetir ve farklı oyun içi zafer türlerine yönelir. Bilimsel, kültürel, diplomatik ya da askeri zaferler gibi farklı seçenekler oyuncuya sunulur, ve her seçim kendi stratejisini gerektirir. Ancak, oyun bazen karmaşık hale gelebilir, bu da yeni oyuncuların sistemi öğrenmesini zorlaştırabilir. Öte yandan, her medeniyetin kendine özgü yetenekleri ve oyun tarzları, oyuna çok farklı yaklaşımlar sunar. Diplomasi ve savaş arasındaki ince denge, belirli zamanlarda yapay zekanın oyuncuyu çok zorlamasına sebep olabilir, bu da oyunun bazen can sıkıcı hale gelmesine yol açabilir.

[b]Pozitif:[/b] Derin strateji mekanikleri, çok farklı zafer türleri, her oyunda farklı deneyimler
[b]Negatif:[/b] Zorlayıcı yapay zeka, yeni oyuncular için karmaşıklık, oyun bazen tekrarlayıcı olabilir

[b]Grafikler ve Ses[/b]
Civilization VI, alışılmışdan daha renkli ve neşeli bir görsel tarza sahiptir. İleriye dönük bir dünya inşa etmeniz için oyunun sunduğu harita, daha ayrıntılı hale gelmiş ve iyi bir görsel tasarıma sahip. Ancak, bazı harita tasarımlarının karmaşık hale gelmesi veya 3D karakter modellerinin yeterince detaylı olmaması, estetik açıdan düşüşe sebep olabiliyor. Bununla birlikte, ses tasarımı başarılıdır; müzik, tarihi motifler eşliğinde harika bir atmosfer yaratır. Diplomasi veya savaşlarda geçen ses efektleri yerinde kullanılmış ve oyununa daha fazla strateji katmanı ekler.

[b]Pozitif:[/b] Renkli ve detaylı grafikler, tarihi atmosferi yansıtan müzik
[b]Negatif:[/b] Bazı karakter modelleri yetersiz, harita ve görseller bazen karmaşıklaşabiliyor

[b]Hikaye ve Zorluk[/b]
Her oyunda farklı bir medeniyetin lideri olarak oynadığınız için, hikaye tamamen oyuncunun seçimine bağlıdır. Ancak, uzun süren oyun oturumları ve genişlemeci doğa bazen yavaş ilerlemeye ve tekdüzelik hissine yol açabiliyor. Bir medeniyeti yönetmek bazen uzun vadede sıkıcı hale gelebiliyor, ancak bazı güçlü anlar ve stratejik hamleler tekrar tekrar motivasyon kaynağı olabilir. Yapay zeka ise, zaman zaman zorluk yaratabilecek şekilde "abartılı" hamleler yapabilir, bu da oyunun insan ile yapay zekâ arasındaki dengeyi zorlaştırabilir.

[b]Pozitif:[/b] Kendi hikayenizi yaratma, her oyun benzersiz
[b]Negatif:[/b] Zaman zaman tekrar eden ilerleme, bazen zorlu yapay zeka

[b]Genel Değerlendirme[/b]
Civilization VI, strateji türünde derinlemesine bir deneyim sunan bir oyun olsa da, bazı öğeleri yeni oyuncular için karmaşık ve bunaltıcı olabilir. Ancak, derinliği ve çok çeşitli strateji seçenekleri, Civilization hayranları için mükemmel bir deneyim sunuyor. Bazı tekrar eden görevler ve güçlü yapay zeka savaşları olsa da, oyun sonunda zafer kazanmanın tatmin edici bir ödüllendirme sistemi sunduğu kesin.

[b]Puanlama[/b]
[b]Oynanış:[/b] 9/10
[b]Grafikler:[/b] 7/10
[b]Hikaye:[/b] 8/10
[b]Genel:[/b] 8/10

[b]Sonuç:[/b] Sid Meier's Civilization VI, büyük strateji oyunları sevenler için mükemmel bir seçenek. Oyun karmaşık olabilir, fakat sunduğu derinlik ve çeşitli strateji seçenekleri ile uzun süreli keyifli bir deneyim sunuyor. Yine de, bazı oyun mekanizmalarının tekrarlayan bir hale gelmesi ve güçlü yapay zekanın bazen yıpratıcı olması, olumsuz etki yaratabilir.

184490600.review: This is by far the dumbest Civ ever. It's politically woke, not well thought out militarily and unbalanced regarding strategic resources. It attempts to shoehorn "eco friendly" power generation in with zero regard to environmental cost, ie no petroleum required to create wind turbines and no mining required to create solar plants. There is no thought given to energy storage such as battery plants, which makes solar a ridiculous concept (California). Uranium is super scarce so you can't rely on nuclear power and although you can win a science victory by colonizing mars or creating "giant death robots" there is no fusion power. There isn't even a mid tier choice such as LNG. Just coal, oil, nuclear or magic democrat eco pixies. Stealth is a tech but your bombers are 1950's era B-52's. An attack helicopter is a Vietnam war era UH-1 Huey...the absurdity goes on and on. Don't buy the fan-soy-boy hype, this game sucks. It's blatant propaganda. Also cartoons...why?

184486900.review: Turn-based strategy where getting the upper hand over your opponent is a multi-pronged and many-faceted race to the top. Start in ancient times, and progress to modern technologies faster than the other opponents on the map. I enjoyed the replay value, as the map seeding makes every game a different challenge - and the computer controlled characters made reasonable negotiations and had decent battle tactics. Being able to cooperatively play with friends and wife also solid pros going for the game. Graphics are decent with smooth cinematics, although being able to pull back on the camera a bit more on the overworld to see a little more map would be nice. All in all, a solid game with many more hours to be played.
