184473478.review:
Civilization VI is a masterpiece that redefines the genre. With its deep mechanics, stunning visuals, and endless replayability, Civ VI offers an unparalleled experience that both long-time fans and newcomers can appreciate. Whether you're a seasoned strategist or a curious explorer, this game is an absolute must-play.

A World That Breathes Life
One of the first things you'll notice about Civilization VI is its vibrant and visually stunning art style. The colorful, hand-painted aesthetic makes every map feel alive, whether you're navigating lush jungles, snow-capped mountains, or sprawling deserts. Cities grow dynamically on the map, expanding outward in a way that feels organic and visually rewarding. The animations, from the bustling city centers to the expressive leaders, are rich with personality and detail. This level of artistry not only enhances immersion but also makes the game accessible and inviting.

Depth That Rewards Strategy
Civilization VI's gameplay is a perfect balance of complexity and accessibility. At its core, the game remains true to the series' hallmark formula: guiding a civilization from the dawn of humanity to the modern age. However, Civ VI introduces several innovative mechanics that elevate the experience.

The district system is a standout feature, allowing players to specialize cities by building districts for science, culture, religion, or military. This adds a new layer of strategic depth, as placement on the map and adjacency bonuses can significantly impact your civilization's efficiency. It’s a satisfying puzzle to solve and ensures that every decision feels meaningful.

The tech and civics trees are another highlight, splitting technological and cultural advancements into separate paths. This dual progression system provides more flexibility and rewards players who adapt their strategies to their surroundings. The inclusion of eurekas and inspirations—boosts that speed up research when specific objectives are met—encourages experimentation and exploration.

Dynamic Diplomacy and Engaging Leaders
Civ VI excels in its portrayal of diplomacy and leader interactions. Each leader has a distinct personality and agenda, influenced by both historical context and in-game developments. For example, Cleopatra might favor players with a strong military presence, while Gandhi may prioritize peace and religion. These dynamic behaviors create a sense of unpredictability and make interactions feel genuine.

The diplomacy system has been refined to allow for more nuanced negotiations. Alliances, trade agreements, and joint wars offer a range of options to navigate the political landscape. The addition of emergencies—global events triggered by a player’s actions, such as conquering a city-state—adds a layer of drama and tension, encouraging cooperation or rivalry among civilizations.

Endless Replayability
One of Civilization VI's greatest strengths is its replayability. The combination of procedurally generated maps, diverse civilizations, and multiple victory conditions ensures that no two games are ever the same. Whether you aim for a cultural victory with France, a scientific triumph with Korea, or a religious conquest with Arabia, the variety of playstyles keeps the experience fresh and engaging.

The expansions, Rise and Fall and Gathering Storm, further enrich the game by introducing mechanics like loyalty, natural disasters, and climate change. These additions deepen the strategic possibilities and make the world feel even more dynamic and responsive.

A Game for Everyone
Civilization VI is remarkably accessible for a game of its depth. The tutorial system is robust, guiding new players through the basics without overwhelming them. At the same time, the game offers enough complexity to challenge even the most seasoned veterans. The scalable difficulty levels ensure that players of all skill levels can find a rewarding experience.

Multiplayer mode adds another layer of excitement, allowing you to test your strategic mettle against friends or strangers. The shared moments of triumph and betrayal make for unforgettable stories and elevate the social aspect of the game.

A Symphony of Sound and Atmosphere
The audio design in Civilization VI is nothing short of spectacular. The soundtrack, composed by Christopher Tin and others, evolves as your civilization progresses, blending traditional and modern themes. The iconic theme song, “Sogno di Volare,” perfectly encapsulates the spirit of exploration and ambition. Sound effects, from the clanging of swords to the hum of modern machinery, further immerse you in the world.

Conclusion: A Timeless Classic
Civilization VI is a triumph of game design, offering a rich and rewarding experience that stands the test of time. Its blend of strategic depth, visual splendor, and dynamic gameplay makes it a standout in the genre. Whether you're forging alliances, waging wars, or building wonders, every moment in Civ VI feels meaningful and satisfying.

For fans of strategy games, Civilization VI is a must-have. It captures the essence of what makes the series great while introducing innovations that push the boundaries of the genre. With its endless possibilities and unparalleled charm, Civ VI is not just a game — it's an adventure through the ages.

184457368.review:
Das Spiel ist komplex so das man selbst mit Vorwissen aus früheren Teilen der Civilization-Reihe (bei mir I bis IV) einige Zeit braucht um es ernsthaft spielen zu können. Mittlerweile habe ich mein erstes (Solo) Marathon-Spiel als Kleopatra (ägyptisch) beendet. Durch die Civilopädiie und der spielinternen Hilfe wird einem der Einstieg erleichtert. Nun muss ich mich weiter auf die Feinheiten der Spielmechanik konzentrieren, wie z.B. wie man Nachbarschaftsboni von Bezirken optimal ausnutzt.

Der Kritikpunkt bei Civilization VI ist oft die ungenügende KI, die eine "richtige" Kriegsführung nicht zukässt. Ich spiele diese Version noch nicht lange und hatte bis jetzt nur einen kurzen militärischen Konflikt mit einem Nachbarn, also kann ich noch nicht viel dazu sagen. Auch spiele ich lieber auf Kultursieg als auf Eroberung.

An Tiefe lässt Civilzation VI fast nichts zu wünschen übrig. Neue Funktionen wie Naturkatastrophen, der Treibhauseffekt und Agenden der KI-Anführer bringen Frische ins Spiel. Die Rolle der Religionen wurde weiter verstärkt, so dass jetzt sogar eine Religionssieg möglich ist. Durch die Einführung von Bezirken erstrecken sich Gebäude nicht unbedingt nur auf das Stadtfeld. Man muss planen wo man sie errichtet.
Die Stadtstaaten sind eine Art Vasallenstaaten, um deren Suzerenität die einzelnen Teilnehmer mit Gesandten konkurrieren. Man kann die Stadtstaaten auch erobern. 
Im Laufe des Spiels kommt die Spionage hinzu, die schon in früheren Versionen von Civilization enthalten war.

Bis jetzt klare Kaufempfehlung dank dem stark reduzierten Preis und der Motivation und Wissensvermittlung die das Spiel bietet.

184429166.review:
Yo hacía bastante tiempo había jugado un juego de mesa bastante similar (que al final resultó ser otro que también está en Steam), y siempre me había asombrado este anuncio cada vez que, de manera errónea buscaba este juego.

Total, que en las rebajas de verano 2024 decidí comprarlo con el poco saldo que aún me quedaba tras haberme comprado varios juegos de última hora. No le tenía muchas esperanzas, hasta que un día decidí instalarlo.

Es un juego de estrategia, a mi parecer, bastante entretenido, y que, en el modo de un jugador, me da la flexibilidad de continuar partidas en cualquier momento. Al principio es verdad que te cuesta entender algunas mecánicas si eres completamente nuevo (como me ocurrió a mí), pero luego es demasiado adictivo. "¡Un turno más!", decía yo llegando tarde a todos sitios y dejando otras cosas de lado para continuar con la partida.

Aún no he tenido tiempo para probar el modo multijugador, así que, si algún día lo pruebo, actualizaré esta parte de la reseña (con algunas adiciones que halle pasado el tiempo, claro)

Los gráficos, contando que es un juego del 2016, han envejecido bastante bien, la banda sonora es impresionante, los efectos de sonido igual... En fin, que si buscas un juego de estrategia, parecido a un juego de mesa, este es el tuyo. Aprovecha para comprarlo en las rebajas que, aunque no compres las ediciones Platino / Anthology, lo vas a amortizar bastante por €2.99.

感觉玩感觉玩哪个文明，就会收获一点经验。
玩德国，我学会了区域规划，吃到了区域相邻加成，吃到了区域对城市的加成。从此变成强迫症，三格之外必建城。
玩蒙古，我知道了文明能见度。所以以后玩的不管是不是蒙古，打架之前一定会完成一条商路。间谍必须安排，科技也先走纸图书。
玩希腊，我意识到城邦的重要性，即使他违反了我的三格建成原则，我也不会再打他了，因为他善，承包自身提供的特殊加成是无可比拟的。除非这个词条我看不懂。
玩女拜拜，发现了真爱，所以以后的别的文明我基本上都带它
玩毛利，我学会了随地大小便
玩朱弟，意识到人口的重要性，瓶琴，鸽子其实相对于游戏胜利都不是最重要的，最最重要的两个产值是粮食和生产力，这两个产值达到平衡后，那么别的产值他也会不请自来

184318618.review:
[h2] 被包装成游戏的民俗音乐专辑 [/h2]
是的，音乐专辑就是我对文明Ⅵ最深的感受，根本原因在于一百小时的游玩时间对于这样一款内容庞大的策略游戏来说只能算堪堪入门，游戏内的每一种民族、每一位领袖都能书写一段独特的文明发展史，在此之余，你仿佛置身于一场民俗音乐会中，聆听着各种民族乐器演奏的先辈歌谣，感受不同文化的差异与魅力。在这里，你能听到中华的《茉莉花》《渔舟唱晚》、英格兰的《Scarborough Fair (斯卡布罗集市)》、奥斯曼的《Yelkenler Biçilecek (旱地行舟)》、法兰西的《Quand je bois du vin clairet (当我喝了清酒)》、沙俄的《Калинка (卡林卡)》、苏格兰的《Scotland the Brave (苏格兰勇士)》、朝鲜的《아리랑 (阿里郎)》、美国的《Hard Times Come Again No More (艰苦的日子不再有)》、毛利的《Pokarekare Ana (河流湍湍)》、德国的《Ich hab die Nacht geträumet (我梦见一个夜晚)》。哪怕你不曾接触此类游戏，我也会真心推荐b站上的 文明Ⅵ bgm合集，它真的非常值得一听！~
[h2] 与时代伴肩发展的音乐 [/h2]
除音乐种类的多样性外，在游戏内，同一首音乐也会随着时代的变迁在演奏上发生明显变化。以《茉莉花》为例，远古时期的它只由一架古筝弹奏，空灵又深邃，如同那个蛮荒时代；到了中世纪、工业时代时，其演奏逐步添加了管弦乐器，显得渐渐厚重；而到了最后的原子能时代，《茉莉花》更是发展为一首磅礴恢弘的交响乐。此刻，音乐仿佛见证着文明从筚路蓝缕到终至玉成的各个阶段，并伴随着你的开拓而接续成长。
[h2] 关于文明Ⅶ [/h2]
在TGA上听到了文明Ⅶ的新主题曲，之后搜了完整版并循环了好久。近几代的文明主题曲都分别描绘着鲜明的主题，最喜欢的还是Ⅳ、Ⅵ和Ⅶ。其中，Ⅳ代用斯瓦西里语写的《Baba Yetu (我们的天父)》唱诵的是宗教信仰与民族团结；Ⅵ代用意大利语写的《Signo di Volare (飞天之梦)》描绘的是人类的探索与开拓；而新一代(Ⅶ)的主题曲《Live Gloriously》则在映照文明诞生以来的纷乱与争斗，一如2024年份下，这个动荡不安的世界。

184295644.review: 绝对是一款令人惊艳的游戏!从一开始进入游戏，就被它精美的画面所吸引。每一个场景都像是一幅精心绘制的画卷，细节之处尽显开发者的用心。游戏的玩法丰富多样，无论是主线任务还是支线任务，都充满了挑战性和趣味性。战斗系统设计得十分巧妙，操作手感流畅，让玩家能够充分体验到战斗的快感。而且游戏中的角色形象塑造得非常成功，每个角色都有自己独特的性格和背景故事，仿佛是真实存在的人物。音效方面也相当出色，背景音乐与游戏场景完美融合，增强了游戏的沉浸感。在玩这款游戏的过程中，时间总是过得飞快，它无疑是一款能够让玩家沉浸其中、爱不释手的佳作。

184213823.review: As a long-time fan since the original Civilization, I can confidently say Civilization VI is an epic addition to the franchise. The level of detail is astounding, from the beautifully rendered world to the intricate mechanics. What truly sets this version apart is the expanded victory conditions. While domination is always an option, the cultural, scientific, and especially religious victories add incredible depth. I’ve found myself engrossed in spreading my chosen faith across the globe, a compelling alternative to traditional warfare. Each civilization feels uniquely powerful, boasting distinct bonuses and units that encourage diverse playstyles. While there's always room for improvement in any game, I gladly spend countless hours immersed in building my empire. Whether you prefer a peaceful, culturally focused approach or a warmongering empire, Civilization VI offers a satisfying and endlessly replayable experience. This isn't just a worthy sequel.

184210459.review:
I have played Civ from the first to the last, and looking forward to Civ7 when it comes out.
The current iteration Civ6 is very well polished, although it's not without its problems. Beyond turn 150 or so it becomes a slog. Each turn having to micro manage production in inconsequential cities, units, builders, repairing constant disasters throughout the empire, etc. Another problem is the unintuitive and disconnected mechanics of the cultural, diplomatic and religious victory modes, not to mention the newest additions (heros, etc).
The main reason for the negative review though is the frequent crashes, sometimes very early on the game. I'm running on a very clean/standard Mac M1 Pro through Steam. I have always had some crashes in late game if the map if very big, but now it just crashes for no reason on turn 20, and it really kills the buzz (it takes a while to restart and reload a saved game!)

184209335.review:
Игра классная: достаточное кол-во цивилизаций для игры даже без DLC, хорошо проработанные регионы и особенности государств(особенно хорошо они проработаны на больших и огромных картах). Важные нюансы игры:
- Важна каждая мелочь, которую ты делаешь в игре: на ранних этапах игры можно спокойно потерять преимущество буквально за один ход потому, что ты вовремя не взял ускорение технологии у дружеского поселения
- Прочитайте руководство. Да, оно долгое, но если не прочитаете, вы можете часов 30-40 просидеть пока разберетесь с механиками игры самостоятельно
- Не недооценивайте ботов. Особенно на сложности выше князя. Они играют иногда даже лучше, чем реальные игроки т.к они идут по четко заданному плану(в отличии от некоторых игроков)
- Сделайте план победы, которой вы хотите добиться поскольку если этого не сделать, то скорее всего вы проиграете, как у меня получилось с первой игрой, где я играл за Монтесуму, набирал очки, не знал о разных типах побед, а меня Россия в какой-то момент обогнала по культуре и получила культурную победу.
В целом, я советую эту игру. Классно подходит как для одиночных игр, так и поиграть с друзьями, но эта игра точно не подойдет тем, кто не любит вникать в характеристики, особенности, детали. В этой игре они прям решают

184193313.review:
If you like strategy, you will love this game! 10/10 would recommend to those with patience and a love for turn-based strategy games.
It did take me a good long while to figure out all of the game mechanics, since there are sooo many combinations you can do to get yourself a win in just one of the five categories. Figuring out how all of the specialty districts and policy cards and governors work will take a second but that's just half of the fun tbh. You can find little cheats to get yourself closer to a win and ways to speed up things which is also fun. 
Fair warning though: games can take up to multiple hours (unless you're speedrunning or working on it in pieces) and usually require short periods of stopping to plan out where you'll place things in your cities. Luckily, the game has a feature where you can place markers of where you'd like to place things and a toggle to see the yields on every tile. I also really like that as you get higher in levels, there are more things added that you have to factor in, rather than just making the AI play more aggressively or something. It teaches you, as the user, to think harder about your next move and to consider your placement of units more. It's very user friendly for both beginners and more advanced players and the learning curve isn't too bad, it just takes a long time. (My first win was at around 70-80 hours of total playtime and on prince difficulty, but after that, I kept winning at higher difficulty levels and under different win conditions)

183957312.review:
在文明六中，我是一名文明的缔造者，见证了水下第一个生命的萌芽，到石器时代的巨型野兽，再到人类的直立行走的每一个瞬间。
市政的变革改变着城市的命运。当规划整齐的街道取代杂乱的小巷，当游乐场为市民提供宜居之所，城市的忠诚不断提升，人口随之蓬勃增长。每一项政策的更迭，都让城市更加充满生机。
当金库日渐枯竭时，交易和战争成为不得不选择的道路。铁蹄踏过远方的城邦，掠夺而来的财富填补帝国的空虚。历史总是在征服与被征服中改写，一如游戏中不断更迭的势力版图。
商业是推动文明进步的引擎。商路如同经络，将科技与信仰传遍帝国的每个角落。看着商队跋涉于丝绸之路，战船穿梭于海上航线，文明在贸易的浪潮中不断向前。
奇观是人类最璀璨的明珠，每一座都在增添着时代的分数。从金字塔到牛津大学，它们不仅是砖石的堆砌，更是对永恒的执着追求。当我凝视这些伟大的建筑，仿佛能看到人类文明的跃迁。
文明六一直有一个飞天梦。从修建登月设施开始，每一回合发射一次的火箭动画都令人屏息。点开科技详情，倒计时着距离飞向太空的回合数，直到最后一刻，火箭终于冲破大气层，将人类送向星辰大海。在那一瞬间，看着胜利的画面，我第一次热泪盈眶，第一次对文明感到震撼。
这不仅是一场游戏，更是对人类文明的致敬。从最初的蹒跚学步，到最后征服太空，每一步都是对历史的重塑与思考。正因如此，我愿意用一生来玩这个游戏，因为在这里，我们不只是在玩游戏，更是在书写属于人类的传奇。
(缺点:byd后期打的多了真的坐牢,机械性的等回合刷经验,提升兵力,等科技点,没有一点点能动性,经典损坏,经典突发情况修理,没有创新和眼前一亮的突发事件,而且人机是真的人机,不懂交易,毫无预告的谴责,毫无预告的和好,有点瑕疵,但总归瑕不掩瑜,值得推荐,等等明年文明7喽)

183949069.review:
Boring, boring, boring.
Next turn, next turn, next turn.
Played 1 game on a tiny map, and it took 10 hours to complete.
Absolutely nothing interesting happened in those 10 hours.
One of my Power Plants was sabotaged randomly...and that was the only "action" that happened.
The barbarians were long, long gone and the CPU barely did anything.

Amenities are annoying to manage...sometimes citizens are unhappy then out of the blue everything is great (there even is the achievement "everything is awesome!" for happy citizens. CPU will randomly get mad at you like other reviews mention. Also, one civ declared war on me but sent NOTHING to attack me with. The decision was so stupid that I took over one of their cities with my boats (forgot what specific name they were) before accepting their peace offering (along with some pocket change they offered with it)

Maybe the game is more fun on larger maps? Maybe I will revisit and try to play on a regular continent map to see if gameplay is actually fun, but for now this gets a big MEH review and a long break from playing.

Update: Yeah, it's just not fun. Nothing about the gameplay makes me want to dive into a session of this. Absolutely nothing happens on regular (Prince or below) difficulty as stated above, and higher difficulty just means the CPU will have unlimited gold and declare an unprovoked "Surprise War!" on you. Surprise War this: EXIT TO DESKTOP.

183828008.review:
Sid Meier's Civilization VI? More like Sid Meier's Hand-Holding Simulator. Thought I could bring the glory of the Enclave to a world of pathetic squabbling nations. Instead, I’m stuck negotiating with a talking teddy bear from Canada and a psychotic queen who keeps denouncing me because I 'nuked her capital.'

Diplomacy? Useless. Every AI leader is mad about something. 'Oh, you built too many cities,' 'Oh, you declared war on everyone,' 'Oh, you dropped 15 nukes.' Get over it. It's called progress.

Unit management? Weak. Where’s my vertibird squads and my advanced power armor? I had to lead a bunch of spearmen against tanks at one point. Embarrassing. If I was in charge, this planet would be a crater by turn 100.

Game’s addictive, though. Played 12 hours straight and forgot to shit. Gandhi betrayed me, so I spent the next 200 turns exterminating him and his puny empire. That's what you get, pacifist scum.

6/10. Needs more mutants and plasma weapons.

Me personally, I like both of them for different reasons.

5 is definitely more fun with friends, I enjoy the multiplayer more and the mechanics support multiplayer better for sure (in my opinion) but I thoroughly enjoy 6 when I'm playing it alone. The Scenarios are fun, the mechanics and districts are cool and I somewhat like the builder changes.

I'm sick of seeing people say this game sucks, It doesn't, It's just different.

Both games capture the Civilization gameplay perfectly and I enjoy playing them with friends or without.

183752417.review:
Así que esto es lo que se dedicó a hacer dios durante 1500 años porque se aburría antes de cansarse de nosotros y abandonarnos.

Siempre he pensado que estos juegos son para chavales con carencias afectivas y un complejo de inferioridad brutal, porque todos los fans locos que he conocido de ellos son así, y bueno, sigo pensándolo, pero el juego es muy bueno y eso hay que reconocerlo.

Se trata de un juego de estrategia basado en turnos, con un modo offline y partida online, en el que desarrollarás una civilización desde lo más básico hasta el mundo moderno. Son partidas relativamente cortas, puesto que se puede ajustar para que una partida según lo que tarden en desarrollarse las mejoras duren media hora o una semana, a gusto del consumidor, pero son finitas y cuentan con cinco formas de ganar: por ciencia, cultura, dominación, religión o por puntuación.

Para ganar por ciencia deberás desarrollar tecnológicamente tu civilización hasta conseguir determinados hitos que te otorgarán la victoria directamente.
Para ganar por cultura deberás sacar una ventaja a nivel cultural, obteniendo obras de arte, museos, etc, que te otorguen una cantidad muy superior porcentualmente de turistas a tus tierras que a las de tus contrincantes.
Para ganar por dominación deberás conquistar cada capital enemiga y agregarlas a tu imperio o destruirlas hasta ser el último jugador de la partida.
Para ganar por religión deberás crear una religión y extender la influencia de la misma hasta ser la religión mayoritaria con una diferencia porcentual muy grande.
Si ningún jugador logra esto pasado el límite de turnos, el que más puntos tenga, obtenidos por ser el que más ha desarrollado los anteriores parámetros en conjunto, será el ganador.

Visualmente el juego esta muy bien, las animaciones de las tropas cumplen y hacen que no sea muy pesado jugarlo a pesar de que a veces se hagan eternas las partidas, pero no lo considero algo muy relevante ya que este tipo de juegos funcionarían igual para los jugadores más hardcore del género con una interfaz mucho más simple, pero creo que acerca a que los jugadores más casuales puedan darle la oportunidad.

En general me parece un muy buen juego, entretenido, complejo, no demasiado difícil pero en el que tu conocimiento acerca de las elecciones que tomar influirán mucho en tus resultados. Un acierto para cualquiera que busque iniciarse en los juegos de estrategia o rememorar viejos tiempos con clásicos del género que hace décadas que no juegan.

civ5を長らくやっていました。そこで今作を１３時間ほどプレイした感じの感想です。
civ５と根本のプレイスタイルは変わりません。国造りゲーとは言いますが、基本的には他国との発展競争になってきます。
ルールやシステムを熟知して、人よりも有利なロケーションを選び、人よりも多く建造物を建て、人よりもはやく都市展開をし、人よりもはやく技術に投資をし、はやく強力なユニットを揃え、外交をオーガナイズして、有利な土地を攻めてメリットを得る。あとはそのタイミングと、指導者ごとのロールプレイの差異を楽しむ。こんな感じです。

ただデザインは綺麗になっていますし、すこしだけ戦略の幅広さが増しています。演出も良くなっています。それにセール価格は尋常じゃないくらい安いし、ほかゲームの繋ぎとして遊ぶのならじゅうぶん楽しいです。ただ、長くゲームしているとやることが変わらないことにだんだん気づいてくるとは思います。でも久しぶりにやると楽しい。そんなゲームだと思います。

183709377.review:
游戏画面与音效：
Civilization VI 的画面表现非常出色，游戏内的场景设计精美细腻，让玩家仿佛置身于一个真实的世界。游戏中的建筑风格各异，展示了不同文明的独特魅力。此外，游戏的音效也非常出色，包括各种背景音乐、战斗音效以及城市的繁华喧嚣等，为玩家营造出一个沉浸式的游戏氛围。

游戏系统与玩法：
Civilization VI 的基本玩法与前作相似，玩家需要选择一个文明开始发展，通过收集资源、建立城市、招募军队、研究科技和发展外交关系等方式来逐步壮大自己的势力。然而，在这个版本中，游戏增加了一些新的元素，如贸易路线、联盟系统和地图编辑器等，使得游戏更加多元化和富有挑战性。

新功能与改进：
贸易路线是 Civilization VI 中的一大亮点。玩家可以通过建立贸易港口和发展商业活动来赚取金币和资源，同时还可以与其他文明进行贸易往来，获取珍贵的商品和科技。这个系统让游戏的经济体系更加复杂多样，也增加了玩家的互动性。

联盟系统是另一个重要的改进。玩家可以加入或创建联盟，与其他玩家共同完成任务和挑战，分享资源和荣誉。联盟系统不仅增强了游戏的合作性，还让玩家在游戏中结识到了更多的朋友。

地图编辑器也是 Civilization VI的一大优势。玩家可以利用这个工具自由定制地图，设计出自己的游戏世界。地图编辑器功能强大，可以满足玩家的各种需求，让游戏更具个性化。

Sid Meier's Civilization VI 在各个方面都有出色的表现，特别是在新功能和改进方面更是让人眼前一亮。这款游戏的画面精美、玩法丰富、互动性强，无论是资深玩家还是新手都能找到属于自己的乐趣。如果你喜欢策略游戏，那么 Civilization VI绝对不容错过。

183619318.review:
Bought it to play with family. I despise this thing.

In Civilization 4, you had information. A city would tell you how much of each resource it was producing, where the production was coming from, what bonuses were in play, what the bonuses were. If there were penalties, that was explicit. The cost of performing an action with a unit was viewable in advance so you could plan for it. The benefit of performing an action was explicit. The benefit of engaging in diplomacy with the AI was clear.

In Civilization 6, none of that information is presented to the player, and if you actively search for it, it's impossible to find. Costs are given in turns to completion instead of hard numbers, which makes any progression practically invisible. Terrain improvement is terribly curtailed and unit movement is an absolute joke. Any feel of the map, the world, and my place in it, is a complete writeoff.

Everything I hated about Beyond Earth is still here. If Civ 7 isn't a complete rollback, I truly hope the studio folds in on itself.

183616000.review:
Civ 4 got me in the door with this series as a kid, Civ 5 to me remains the most playable in a multiplayer sense, Civ 6 is the best though and I WISH that Firaxis gave this one more attention for the online players abound.

If you know what Sid Meier's Civilization is, you know what this game is, a game that surprisingly doesnt have a mainstream board game you can buy at Walmart, because it carries the accessibility AND depth of any good board game, a turn based structure, and an overhead, somewhat simplistic look at civilization creation. Its fantastic and any one of them is worth your money.

Civ Vi does little to innovate the formula, it changes how workers, trade routes, and some other stuff works, but its core is still establish a set of cities, and produce units and improvements to win through culture, faith, domination, etc. What is does change is how land is used: In V, you would make a city and then till whatever resources you hadaround by making mills, mines, farms, etc. Civ VI adds on the concept that you need district tiles as well as certain improvements to the capital need another adjacent tile ro make, adding a little depth to how you use the space/topagraphy around you.\

Workers no longer dig roads and city connections matter less, as trade routes now create roades, leading to a more interesting looking road map on the world, that is also more logical, but eliminating the choice aspect of losing 1 gold per turn to make a road and dictate where it was and went. Workers also expend a charge with every job. In V, workers were a unit that could become useless as you had no improvements or repairs to make, in VI, each unit of worker will do three jobs before disappearing, Each are an interesting approach, 5 allowed you to sleep workers until you needed a new farm or road, to build, whereas Vi helps you to save turn money and use less workers for the job while their improvements are done instantly.

My main complaint is this games internet MP sucks real bad--we have not found a way to avoid desyncs within 20ish turns and desyncs take 20 seconds or so to resolve, an amount of time that really sucks after the 2nd or 3rd desync

183614846.review:
[h2] 《文明6》 [/h2]   [b] 肝疼指数★★★★☆ [/b] 

[h3] 我叫李华 [/h3]
只是这广袤世界中一个微不足道的存在，每日过着平凡且重复的生活。我在田间辛勤劳作，头顶是炽热的太阳，脚下是干涸的土地，心中虽怀揣着对美好生活的一丝向往，却也深知这愿望如同水中月般虚幻，毕竟在这艰难的世道里，仅仅维持生计就已耗尽我全部的精力。然而，命运的齿轮却在悄然转动，一位神秘而伟大的存在 —— 那位操控着文明走向的玩家，闯入了我的世界，从此改变了我的一生。

[h3] 第一座矿山在附近建立时 [/h3]
我望着那忙碌的场景，内心满是好奇与疑惑。这与我日复一日单调的农活如此不同，仿佛是另一个新奇世界的大门在向我敞开。我犹豫再三，最终还是放下了手中那熟悉得不能再熟悉的农具，怀着忐忑的心情加入到挖矿的队伍中。每挥动一下锄头，心中既有对未知的恐惧，又有对改变的期待。“这真的能让生活变好吗？” 我暗自思忖，但看到周围人眼中闪烁的光芒，我又觉得似乎应该相信这股莫名的力量。

[h3] 随着时间缓缓流逝 [/h3]
在玩家的带领下，我们的城市渐渐有了模样。宏伟的城墙高高筑起，坚固的仓库错落林立，我行走在这些建筑之间，心中的震撼如汹涌的浪潮，一波接着一波。“这是我们文明的力量吗？” 我不禁惊叹，曾经以为遥不可及的繁荣，如今正真切地展现在眼前。我深知，自己正站在一个新时代的开端，而这一切都源于那位我从未谋面却又无比敬畏的玩家。

[h3] 不久后 [/h3]
玩家将目光投向了科技的探索。我听闻学者们在研究室里日夜忙碌，那些神秘的仪器和复杂的图纸仿佛来自另一个世界。而我，也有幸参与到一些基础的建设工作中。当第一盏明灯被点亮的那一刻，柔和的光芒瞬间驱散了黑暗，也照亮了我内心深处对未来的憧憬。我呆呆地望着那盏灯，心中涌动着难以言表的激动：“原来我们可以掌控光明，这就是科技的神奇之处吗？也许在这位玩家的带领下，我们真的能够改变世界。” 此后，我们的生活因科技而发生了翻天覆地的变化，耕种变得更加高效，曾经繁重的农活如今轻松了许多，生活也逐渐变得富足起来，我的心中对玩家的决策充满了感激与信任。

[h3] 好景不长 [/h3]
战争的阴云如汹涌的黑色风暴般迅速席卷而来，威胁着我们的家园。我看到士兵们身着冰冷的铠甲，手持锋利的利刃，在城墙下整齐地排列，眼神中透露出坚毅与决绝。那一刻，恐惧紧紧攫住了我的心，但当我看到身边人们那毫不退缩的神情时，一种莫名的勇气在我心中油然而生。“我不能只是躲在后面，我也要为保卫家园出一份力！” 我毅然加入了后勤队伍，为前线的战士们运送物资。在枪林弹雨中穿梭，每一次的心跳都伴随着对生存的渴望和对家园的守护之情。

[h3] 战争的硝烟终将散去 [/h3]
我们的城市满目疮痍，但玩家并未让我们陷入绝望。他带领我们走向文化的繁荣，就像一位智慧的导师，引领我们走向心灵的救赎。剧院里上演着精彩绝伦的戏剧，诗人在街头吟诵着动人的诗篇，那些优美的文字和深情的表演，如涓涓细流，滋润着我干涸已久的心灵。我坐在台下，沉浸在这美妙的氛围中，心中对文明的理解愈发深刻：“原来，我们的生活不仅仅是为了生存，还有这些美好的事物值得我们去追求。这位玩家到底有着怎样的智慧，能为我们创造出如此丰富多彩的世界？”。

[h3] 在玩家的引领下 [/h3]
我们的文明从一个脆弱的幼苗逐渐成长为一棵参天大树。从最初的小村落，一步步发展为如今繁华的城市；从简单粗糙的工具，进化到先进复杂的科技；从懵懂无知地只为生存挣扎，到如今对文化艺术的执着追求。我见证了这一路的风风雨雨，也深知自己在这伟大的文明进程中，虽然渺小如尘埃，却也有着不可或缺的作用。

我不知道未来还会遭遇怎样的挑战和机遇，但在我心中，那位伟大的玩家就是我们文明的灯塔，照亮我们前行的道路。“只要他继续引领我们，我相信，无论前方有多少艰难险阻，我们的文明必将走向更加辉煌的明天。” 我默默发誓，将怀着敬畏与期待，在这片充满希望的土地上，继续书写属于自己的故事，用我的双手和汗水，为我们的文明添砖加瓦，坚定不移地跟随那道指引我们前行的智慧之光，直至生命的尽头。

183592580.review:
Jeśli wyrosłeś na pixel-artowych mapach Civilization I, a później spędzałeś całe noce, licząc zasoby w Civilization IV, to Civilization VI jest niczym długo wyczekiwany sequel Twojego ulubionego sci-fi. Firaxis nie tylko oddało hołd klasyce, ale także wprowadziło innowacje, które przyprawią o szybsze bicie serca każdego fana mikro- i makrozarządzania.
Civilization VI zrywa z tradycją monotematycznych kafelków. Dzięki nowemu systemowi dzielnic (kampus, dzielnica świątynna, dzielnica przemysłowa), Twoje miasta stają się dynamicznymi centrami strategii urbanistycznej. Już nie budujesz "wszystkiego w centrum" – teraz każde pole ma znaczenie, a wybór lokalizacji dla dzielnicy przemysłowej może zdecydować o Twoim zwycięstwie lub porażce.
Dla każdego matematycznego maniaka, który kocha optymalizację: liczby naprawdę mają tutaj znaczenie. Premie z ukształtowania terenu, jak sąsiedztwo gór czy lasów, to elementy, które wymagają analizowania każdego ruchu jakbyś właśnie planował misję na Marsa.
Choć SI przeszło metamorfozę od czasów Civ V, nadal zdarza mu się zachowywać jak gracz, który w środku nocy zbyt wiele razy kliknął "następna tura". Władcy, jak Katarzyna Medycejska czy Montezuma, mają swoje agendy, które jednak czasami prowadzą do irracjonalnych decyzji. Niby Montezuma Cię lubi, bo masz dużo luksusów, ale chwila moment – już wysyła armię pikników pod Twoje miasto.
Gdy patrzysz na mapę w Civ VI, czujesz się jak badacz odkrywający kartografię XVIII wieku. Styl graficzny to połączenie naukowej precyzji i artystycznej swobody, co pozwala mapie „żyć” pod Twoim palcem. Ale to muzyka sprawia, że Civilization VI wspina się na Mount Nerd. Każda cywilizacja ma własny motyw muzyczny, który rozwija się wraz z postępem technologii. Riffy na lutni w epoce średniowiecza zamieniają się w pełne orkiestracje w erze atomowej. Geniusz!
Dodatek Rise and Fall wprowadza mechanikę złotych i ciemnych wieków, dając jeszcze większe pole do geekowskiej analizy. Z kolei Gathering Storm dorzuca katastrofy naturalne i ekologię, co czyni Cię nie tylko władcą, ale i quasi-simsem naukowym, kontrolującym emisję dwutlenku węgla. To, co dla jednych jest dodatkowym smaczkiem, dla nerdów stanowi możliwość pisania własnych podręczników strategii.
Civilization VI to nie tylko gra – to symfonia dla geeków. Możesz być miłośnikiem historii, strategii, optymalizacji lub po prostu masochistą, który chce zobaczyć, jak Gandhi odpala atomówki. Firaxis stworzył grę, która wymaga od Ciebie myślenia, planowania i gotowości na nieprzespane noce.
Czy to gra bez wad? Nie. Ale dla tych, którzy lubią zgłębiać złożone systemy, balansować kulturę, naukę, wojnę i dyplomację, Civilization VI to więcej niż gra. To doświadczenie.
Ocena: 9/10. Geek Level: MAX.
